content.rendered:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

XR Pioneers and Leaders Pack All-Star WebXR Business Summit

New York, NY – Tuesday, September 7, 2021– The XR Industry is rallying around WebXR for an all-day free virtual event, the WebXR Business Summit on September 14th, for  decision-makers to elevate their game onto the Immersive Web. The team that produced The Polys – WebXR Awards and the WebXR Developer Summit is back with a program hosted by Samantha Mathews, CEO/CTO of LOCI, featuring a roster of pioneers and business leaders to discuss the next evolution of the Internet.

WebXR delivers Virtual and Augmented Reality experiences on the open web, making it easy for developers to deploy spatial websites to new immersive stereoscopic 3D headsets, while still supporting billions of 2D mobile and desktop browsers. The WebXR Business Summit will focus on the opportunities and economics of this new medium. Mobile devices, social media, and video transformed the web over the past decade, serving billions of people and creating trillions in wealth, and immersive content is what’s next. 

The WebXR Business Summit features luminaries in the space from around the world, including Alban Denoyel, CEO of Sketchfab, which was recently acquired by Epic Games, maker of Unreal Engine and the popular game Fortnite. CEO Artur Sychov of Somnium Space will present live from his WebXR platform, which is establishing a creator economy around NFTs and virtual real-estate. Gabriel Baker, Poly Award Winner for Developer of the Year and Product Manager for Virbela’s FRAME platform, will talk about virtual events for the education, government, and private sectors in a feature interview with Sophia Moshasha. The panels are moderated by and stacked with prominent industry figures including Tony Parisi of Unity Technologies; Alan Smithson of MetaVRse; Timmu Tõke, CEO of popular avatar platform Ready Player Me; Jamie Burke of Outlier Ventures; and Tom Emrich of 8th Wall.  The day will be co-hosted by Julie Smithson, MetaVRse co-founder, XR Women Global Chair, and host of The Polys – WebXR Awards. For a the full agenda and list of speakers participating at the event visit https://webxr.events/event/webxr-business-summit/ 

Now that Apple has declared that support for the W3C’s Device API specification is in development and integrated into  its to-be-released browser engine WebKit, there is a push to make the specification a standard. Dr. June Wang, SVP at Futurewei Technologies Inc., the event’s lead sponsor, will host a panel called “Building Consensus Around Industry Standards” that features Neil Trevitt, President of The Khronos Group, which created the WebGL, GTLF, and OpenXR standards used by WebXR. Another panel will discuss the business implications of initiatives to make the Metaverse interoperable. Special edition extended interviews with W3C’s Dominique Hazaël-Massieux and Neil Trevitt will take a deeper dive into the standards topic help provide additional context for the summits.

The 2021 WebXR Summit Series will conclude on October 12th with the WebXR Design Summit, hosted by Kent Bye of the Voices of VR podcast, which will onboard creatives into the spatial and experiential medium. The Summits are streamed live on YouTube, Twitch, LinkedIn, and Facebook, and can be enjoyed as a community through a “Meta-Multiverse” of watch parties in VR Platforms including Frame, VRLand, AltSpaceVR, and ENGAGE. The WebXR Summit Series is sponsored by Futurewei Technologies Inc., and advocates for Open Source, Standardization, and Collaboration within the XR Ecosystem. 

The Polys – WebXR Awards and WebXR Summit Series is produced by Point Cloud Productions: Karen Alexander, Steve Lewis, Sophia Moshasha, Linda Ricci and Julie Smithson and created by Ben Erwin. The 2nd Polys – WebXR Awards ceremony will be held on February 12, 2022, with host Julie Smithson and Virtual Red Carpet host Sophia Moshasha. 

Contact: Sophia Moshasha
sophia@thevrara.com 

___________________________________________________________________________

title.rendered: The Polys – WebXR Awards Show Returns To Break More Ground

content.rendered:
The Polys WebXR Awards Show Returns To Break More Ground

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

New York, NY – February 11, 2022; The Polys – WebXR Awards returns Saturday, February 12, 2022 to celebrate the pioneers of the Immersive Web. The Virtual Red Carpet with Sophia Moshasha begins at 2pm Eastern followed by the ceremony, hosted by Julie Smithson. WebXR is the next evolution of the web, allowing accessibility to immersive content and world from any 2D or XR device. This awards show will celebrate pioneers and projects building on this new medium. The Polys – WebXR Awards breaks new ground as the first awards show to:

  • Broadcast the show to and from watch parties in virtual worlds
  • Demonstrate LIVE inter-platform traversing without breaking immersion from VR Land to the XR Women Museum in Frame
  • Have a live halftime show presented by OnboardXR with live singing and mocap dance in WebXR featuring Unwired Dance Theater’s Clemence Debaig, Brendan Bradley, Michael Morran, Maurice Soque Jr., and Christina Karpodini.
  • An After Party in Meta Horizons with a bespoke world created and hosted by Paige Danzinger.

With the innovations this show brings to blend live & virtual production in the metaverse, The Polys has made its name as “the next Emmys” for this new, emerging medium as Emmy winner and Polys’ nominee, Thomas Wallner, describes in this year’s trailer.

This year, The Polys is adding six new awards for a total of seventeen. The new categories are World, Video Experience, Augmented Reality Experience, Creator of the Year, Software of the Year, and the R.O.X. Award – Return on Experience, and a new Community Honor. Winners will be presented with their NFT trophies by an all-star lineup of personalities from the community. 

In order to qualify, nominated experiences must be stereoscopic immersive content that runs on the WebXR Device API. Visit The Polys website to experience nominated projects.

Special honorees include:

  • Lifetime Achievement Award – Brandon Jones, for his contributions to the WebXR Stack.
  • Ombudsperson of the Year – Avi Bar-Zeev for his philosophical contributions to the shaping of the Metaverse, presented by last year’s recipient, Kent Bye.
  • The first Community Honor – Trevor Flowers for his work supporting the W3C Community Group, editor of the Immersive Web Weekly newsletter, and host of the WebXR Developer Summit.

Register for the event here!

The WebXR Summit Series returns in 2022 with three all-new shows: the WebXR Education Summit hosted by Karen Alexander on July 21st, the WebXR Brand Summit hosted by Sophia Moshasha on September 15th, and the WebXR Production Summit hosted by Steve Lewis on October 13th. Futurewei Technologies, sponsors of the 2021 WebXR Summit Series, returns as the lead sponsor for this year’s Polys and Summit Series.

About the Team

The team behind the WebXR Summit series, producers Karen Alexander, Steve Lewis, and Linda Ricci, along with Polys hosts Julie Smithson and Sophia Moshasha and creator Ben Erwin. They produced 10 WebXR events in 2021 to include the first Polys show and movie premiere party, the WebXR Developer Summit hosted by Trevor Flowers, the WebXR Business Summit hosted by Samantha Mathews and the WebXR Design Summit hosted by Kent Bye. 

The team also collaborates on other projects, including the annual VR Charity Golf Tournament Ready Player Golf with Richard Ward, Chris Madsen, Sophia Moshasha and Ben Erwin. Julie Smithson, Sophia Moshasha, and Karen Alexander are co-founders of XR Women, which produced 50 weekly events in their first year.

content.rendered:
Thank you for joining the Jury for The 2nd Polys – WebXR Awards.

The Polys WebXR Awards Event takes place on Saturday, February 12, and will be hosted by Julie Smithson with Virtual Red Carpet Host Sophia Moshasha.

Evaluation of all the experience categories, with the exception of videos, may be done exclusively using the Meta Quest browser. For uniformity of experience, we recommend a Quest 2 headset as not all current WebXR features are supported on Quest 1. Please do not use a 2D desktop browser; this content is intended to be experienced immersively and the immersiveness of the content should be a factor in your evaluations. 

Please read this FAQ and proceed to your ballot below.

When: Voting is open January 24 through February 6.

Where: Your ballot is waiting for you at https://thepolys.com/ballot 

Enter this link into your Quest browser and bookmark it for your convenience.

How:

  • Use the email address where you received your invitation to access your ballot.
  • You can link to the nominated sites directly from the ballot.
  • Voting is ranked choice. Pick your first, second, and third favorite in each category.
  • Click “save” after each entry.
  • You do not have to vote in every category.
  • You do not have to review every category or cast your votes in the same session.
  • You can change your votes before February 7th.
  • For the categories you do choose to vote in, please review all the nominees in that category before casting your votes.

Who: 

  • Jury participation is by invitation only. To discourage lobbying, the list of jurors is not made public.
  • It is not a secret that you are a juror. But we ask you not to publicly discuss or comment on our process. 
    • You may publicly disclose and openly discuss that you are a juror for The Polys, what experiences you liked, and what competitive categories you are excited to see the winners for.
    • We welcome your direct feedback at jury@thepolys.com

Why:

  • To ensure our winners are selected on merit and not by social media popularity or lobbying of judges, we do not crowdsource our votes.
  • We use ranked choice voting for tie-breakers.
  • Voting is blind: votes are recorded by juror ID numbers and matched with experience IDs.

What:

  • Our awards recognize stereoscopic content exclusively. 
  • Many categories are not “apples to apples” comparisons but include experiences from a variety of genres that are made with budgets large and small. 
  • Choose according to your personal taste.
  • The video nominees are qualified because they run in video players for WebXR browsers. You do not have to view the video in a browser to review it as long as you experience it stereoscopically.

content.rendered: Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production. Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

content.rendered:
LISI LINARES is the founder of LNRS PR+ XR TLNT MNGMNT, a boutique publicity and talent management agency that operates in stealth mode. All of the clients come word of mouth.

VR has been Lisi’s passion since she wrote her first VR script at NYU Film in 1994. Too early to start a career in VR, Lisi began making music. She recorded and released songs with influential label, Ze Records. Her music attracted the casting agent for SURVIVOR. She went on to appear as a castaway on season 14. Doing press junkets for CBS lead to a pointing point. “I really got into how a story is pitched and how the narrative of a character is shaped in the media”

In 2015, Lisi co-founded a public relations agency representing primarily Crypto and Blockchain projects. After premiering the first Anime on the blockchain, Vevara in Your Dream and working with some of the bigger projects in the space such as David Chaum’s Elixxir, Path Network and NGRAVE, it was time to move on.
During the summer of 2019 Lisi saw an opportunity to pivot into VR, the great love of her life! Starting with consulting AR start-ups, she quickly became immersed in the XR community. “I feel like I had found my tribe.”

March 2021, Lisi expanded her publicity services to include managing xr talent. She is actively bridging the gap between 20th and 21st century entertainment. Consulting talent agencies on how to prepare their talent roster was the inspiration behind XR TLNT MNGMNT.
Lisi is a proud Board Member of the Femme Futures Grant at Artizen and XR Women.

Stay tuned more to come…

content.rendered:
Jonathan (Jono) Brandel is an award winning graphic designer and computer programmer. He comes from mixed heritage, an American of Filipino and Polish descent. As such Jono pairs distinct subjects to frame the creative process. These combinations range from latin and emojis to lithography and pixel sorting. While pairings vary, there is an accessible tenor to the digital and physical objects he produces. This attention to detail allows people to access complex subject matters including positivism, the collision of black holes, and music composition with ease.

With a Bachelor’s in Design | Media Arts, a Minor in Latin from the University of California, Los Angeles, and a Master of Fine Arts in New Media from Paris College of Art, Jono’s work has been shown at international festivals including TED, Sundance, Tribeca Film Festival, SIGGRAPH, and the Japan Media Arts Festival. His commitment to Visual Music has sparked collaborations with musicians including applications with Lullatone, a live performance with Nosaj Thing, and interactive music videos for the likes of Matthew Dear, the Chemical Brothers, and Kimbra.
To develop his projects Jono writes custom software and actively participates in open source communities. He shares his own libraries such as the event driven two-dimensional drawing interface for the web, Two.js. This library and many others are freely available and actively maintained to help promote the creative expression of individuals worldwide.

Co-Founder at Total-Viz, where he develops XR games.
A Software Developer at Resonai, where he is part of the team that works on Vera, an AR platform that transforms physical spaces into intelligent digital environments.
In his spare time, he works on WebXR Export, a Unity XR package that allows developers to build WebXR experiences using Unity.

Back in 2014 Raanan had made his first contribution to Babylon.js – the web 3D engine. Since then he has continuously contributed to the open source framework as a community member. For the last year he has been working as a software developer @ Microsoft in the Babylon.js team. A major part of his time is invested in developing and maintaining Babylon’s WebXR support. The rest of the time he is trying to configure build systems, fight React, and catch up on E-Mails.
He resides in Berlin, Germany, and enjoys playing multiplayer games with his family, making music, and practicing magic tricks that get him nowhere.

meta.blurb:
This talk is about Babylon.js and its WebXR support. We will talk about the engine itself, the principals that guide us, and the way we see WebXR support and the decisions made when implementing it - simplicity, extensibility, and full support for advanced devs. 
We will see a few XR demos, see the tools the framework provides, talk a bit about Babylon native (cross-platform application development) and go over a few code snippets.
Satisfaction guarantied or your money back!

He’s a quintessential Englishman who loves to drink tea and complain about the weather.

content.rendered: Brendan Andolsek Bradley is a multi-award winning actor, writer, director and producer known internationally as “America’s Scrappy Storyteller” (AR Post) with 100+ IMDb credits, 50M+ views online and a leader in the virtual theater movement performing using groundbreaking XR/VR tools. Brendan established The Integrative Technology Lab at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts to foster the next generation of multi-disciplinary live storytellers and during the pandemic, he began releasing free tutorials and case-studies for adopting ubiquitous streaming tools for live performance, including a customizable virtual theater in your web browser that allows anyone in the world to get back “on” stage for free. More at brendanAbradley.com/futurestages

content.rendered: Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community. Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

content.rendered: Blair MacIntyre is a Professor of Interactive Computing at Georgia Tech, where he has explored socio-technical issues surrounding AR and VR for more than 20 years. He has built authoring toolkits for media designers, deployed room-scale and handheld games and experiences, built AR-enabled web-browsers, helped lead the design of WebXR, and run online conferences using immersive social VR. His experience spans all aspects of building, deploying, and evaluating AR and VR tools, systems, and experiences. He has been doing research in augmented reality since 1991, is actively involved with numerous conferences and workshops, speaks and consults regularly, and has published over 100 academic papers in the field.

Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

content.rendered: Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He’s an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR. He\’s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE’s Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

excerpt.rendered:
Kent will host the
WebXR Design Summit
on October 12

content.rendered: Forest is a co-founder and Chief Product Officer at Pluto VR. The company’s purpose is to help humanity transcend physical location so that everyone can more easily connect, communicate, and collaborate as if they were in person regardless of where they are. Before co-founding Pluto VR he was a creative innovations leader at Deloitte Digital, working with the largest brands in the world to help them stay competitive in the new digital landscape. He has a diverse background including VR, film, marketing, and crowdfunding. Other projects Include: An automated brewing machine kickstarter that makes beer at the press of a button, a new way to train employees through mobile gaming, and the web series Know Your Meme.

Christina Kinne aka XaosPrincess graduated from Munich Filmschool in 2006.She has worked as director, first a.d., producer, editor, set designer, photographer and journalist, and has directed more than ten movies, including one of Europe’s first live-action 3D-films – “Delusion 3D” (2008).

After her parental leave Christina Kinne found a new creative home in Virtual Reality. Using software like Gravity Sketch or Tilt Brush she designs 3D models for VR in VR.Christina Kinne has produced and hosted a variety of Virtual Reality events.As evangelist she also likes to promote VR in real life – be it by screening live VR content to a RL audience or by producing educational videos.

In July 2020 Christina Kinne joined Tivoli Cloud VR as CMO and Events Manager to help making the dream of a friendly, creative and inclusive metaverse come true.Currently she is also pursuing a second MA in “Digital Narratives” at the International Filmschool Cologne.

Arome Ibrahim is an Immersive 360°VR Developer, Geographer & Applied Meteorologist, environmentalist, XR for Good advocate, a social innovator who strongly believes in utilizing technology, more broadly innovation to build and grow impact-based solutions in Africa.

He is the co-founder of Experis Immersive – an Extended Reality (XR) content development startup creating immersive, innovative, and interactive experiences.

Arome is also the team lead at Immersive Tech Africa, a creative social enterprise that leverage Extended Reality (XR) technologies like Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented reality (AR), 360VR to create impact-driven experiences and solutions that inspire global action towards the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Arome has been recognized as a virtual reality technology innovator by the Next Economy program, awarded the Next Economy Entrepreneurship Hero and the Next Economy Impact Award made possible by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

His project, Virtuality Africa – a virtual museum of contemporary arts in Africa, was selected for the Digital Lab Africa #5 XR category project award.

He is currently an active volunteer with several industry organizations, including Google Street View, Google AR/VR, VR AR MR, AR/VR Africa, International Virtual Reality Professionals Association, Young Sustainable Impact, WebXR, Earthpreneurs, YALI Africa, SDG Nigeria, XR4ALL, Tourism 4.0, Tourism for SDGs, Royal African Young Innovators.

Arome firmly believes that immersive technology has an influential role in the future development of Africa and is committed to making this happen.

content.rendered:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO/CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

excerpt.rendered:
Samantha will host the
WebXR Business Summit
on September 14

meta.talk_description: Utilizing the web's ability to reach everyone on earth while also delivering stable immersive experiences calls for creativity, grit and patience. Perhaps with new protocols for decentralization, creator friendly game engines, lightweight headsets and digital twins we can collectively imagine an infrastructure that supports all visions of a shared immersive web.

Terry co-produced the XRCollaboration.com website – part of his effort to inspire us to use XR technologies to improve our interactions with each other and the real world. His mission is to encourage us to move from a heads-down to a heads-up society. Terry regularly mentors innovators trying to make a difference in XR through Deutsche Telekom’s startup accelerator hub:raum and other programs.

Hugh Hou is a Co-Founder and Creative Director for CreatorUp, a digital media education company and production studio. He heads up immersive media content creation and has produced VR content for numerous companies and organizations such as Samsung, the Special Olympics, Google, Oculus, MasterCard, Twitter, TikTok, RedBull Music, LACOSTE, Huawei, and the Los Angeles Police Department.
He also directs and produces Mixed Reality music videos. He worked with musical artists such as I Prevail, Joyner Lucas, Kristina Sky, Roger Shah, Cypress Hill, and SHAED.
When not producing original VR videos & films, Hugh dedicates his time to sharing his vast expertise in immersive technologies and VR filmmaking on the CreatorUp YouTube channel. He truly believes that by sharing freely with the world through YouTube, mentoring and consulting, more creators will join the immersive media family.
Hugh’s goal is to help the VR industry thrive and to improve the quality of VR filmmaking.

Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

He is also an admin and consultant for the yearly BRCvr virtual \”Burning Man\” event held in Altspace, and has worked with many people to help bring their creative ideas to fruition. content.rendered: Christina is the CEO of Metastage. Since its founding in 2018, Metastage has completed over 150 productions with major brands and award winning projects, including two Emmy nominations. Metastage is the first North American partner for the Microsoft Mixed Reality Capture technology. Prior to leading Metastage, Christina was the CEO of VR Playhouse, an immersive content company with immersive projects featured at SXSW, Sundance, and Festival de Cannes. She is a recipient of the Advanced Imaging Society\’s Distinguished Leadership in Technology Award and was named in the Huffington Post as one of 5 women changing the virtual reality scene. Her writing and research on volumetric video has been published in the textbook, Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (2019), and What is Augmented Reality? Everything You Wanted to Know Featuring Exclusive Interviews with Leaders of the AR Industry (2019).

content.rendered: Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies. She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem. She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless. In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device. In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line. In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS). In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.

content.rendered:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.
By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.
Christi received her Master\’s degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

content.rendered: Danny Stefanic is the creator of the world\’s first metaverse-for-business platform, spawning both MootUp for virtual events and LearnBrite for simulation and training. He is the inventor of the first 3D metaverse ExitReality, founder of the International Virtual Reality Association and chairman of the virtual worlds social network Koinup. Called a “visionary” by his peers and deemed by Wall Street CIOs and Silicon Valley VCs to be “one of the pioneers in his field”, he has been creating ground-breaking 3D businesses for over 29 years. Danny actively works with young businesses to share his experiences and give back to the community. He has assisted companies with angel investment, international licensing, acquisitions, exits, managing distributed teams and has personally closed IP acquisitions valued at $85MM.

content.rendered: Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide. Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

content.rendered: Fabien Bénétou is a WebXR freelance developer currently working for UNICEF and the European Parliament. Based in Brussels, Belgium, Fabien is a Mozilla AFrame contributor driven by the need to make virtual and augmented reality understandable by anybody curious enough to try. He has organized events, given talks and lead dozens of professional workshops all around the world. His focus goes beyond the technology to the positive impact it can offer through privacy conscious methods to bring VR and AR innovations to the most wide possible audience. He is convinced that XR will become useful once used and challenged by the most diverse audience.

Is WebXR good enough today? Can you use your current tools? Do you need to hire new developers? What are all the efforts for?

Through case encounted prototyping for the European Parliament and supporting startups selected by the UNICEF Innovation Fund we will explore each of those tricky questions and more.

What business problems does WebXR solve today?

content.rendered: Jamie is the CEO and founder of Outlier Ventures. He was an early investor in Bitcoin and Ethereum and founded Outlier Ventures, the Web 3.0 startup accelerator, in 2014. He is an active collector of NFTs and a passionate proponent of the Open Metaverse theory (you can read the thesis: https://outlierventures.io/research/the-open-metaverse-os/). The Open Metaverse thesis was created early 2021 after months of development, and acts as a toolkit to design alternatives based on principles of user centricity and sovereignty of identity, data and wealth. Jamie is an active media commentator and has spoken on stages across the world about the breadth of opportunity Ethereum posses to serve as the foundation for the next generation of the internet. He is an active collector of NFTs, co-founding 100xARt, a community of the Top 200 collectors and has helped launch the world\’s first d-zine, NFTs.WTF, an independent NFT media property owned and controlled by a DAO of 100 industry leaders, creatives and influencers.

_thumbnail_id.desc: Jamie is the CEO and founder of Outlier Ventures. He was an early investor in Bitcoin and Ethereum and founded Outlier Ventures, the Web 3.0 startup accelerator, in 2014. He is an active collector of NFTs and a passionate proponent of the Open Metaverse theory (you can read the thesis: https://outlierventures.io/research/the-open-metaverse-os/). The Open Metaverse thesis was created early 2021 after months of development, and acts as a toolkit to design alternatives based on principles of user centricity and sovereignty of identity, data and wealth. Jamie is an active media commentator and has spoken on stages across the world about the breadth of opportunity Ethereum posses to serve as the foundation for the next generation of the internet. He is an active collector of NFTs, co-founding 100xARt, a community of the Top 200 collectors and has helped launch the world\'s first d-zine, NFTs.WTF, an independent NFT media property owned and controlled by a DAO of 100 industry leaders, creatives and influencers.

meta.talk_title: Designing Accessible Interactions for the Immersive Web
meta.talk_description: Immersive applications as a new medium have evolving design paradigms. Substantial work has been done to define accessibility guidelines for the traditional 2D web, but efforts are still in progress to ensure the immersive web is accessible to all individuals.  In this presentation, we will explore how interactions in immersive applications can be designed to support a variety of input devices and allow more people to fully experience the immersive web.

content.rendered:
Alex Howland, Ph.D., is president and co-founder of Virbela, a virtual world platform for remote work, learning, and events. Howland created Virbela in 2012, before it was purchased and made public by eXp World Holdings in 2018.

Virbela’s mission is to help organizations and people thrive in a remote-first future. Alex leads the development of Virbela’s products and services — continuing to expand the platform to accommodate not just business workspaces, but classrooms, event spaces, and recreational areas as well.

Prior to co-founding Virbela, Howland was an instructor in the Psychology Department at University of California, San Diego, where he taught Industrial and Organizational Psychology to undergraduate students. His expertise in organizational psychology gives him a unique perspective on creating virtual work and education spaces. He designed Virbela specifically to create a unique virtual experience where users feel psychologically safe and are more likely to collaborate, brainstorm, and succeed.

Howland has a bachelor of science in psychology from Providence College, and his Ph.D. in organizational psychology from Alliant International University, San Diego.

content.rendered: Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality. Dedicated to \”Creating Better Worlds\” as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM\’s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members. He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

content.rendered:
Ritesh is as a digital and social evangelist who has been evangelizing digital since the early days of the dot com boom in the late 1990\’s. Early in his career, he joined Agency.com and quickly began to consult with major fortune 500 companies to evangelize the merits of the World Wide Web.

Along the way, he worked for the likes of Havas, Cushman & Wakefield and began a deep dive into the healthcare arena in 2009 when he joined Inventiv Health as Head of Digital & Innovation. There, he was a pioneer in the use of the emerging social media platforms, winning a CLIO award in 2010 for the Novartis Tobi Facebook page under the category of “Best Use of Social Media in 2010” for that work.

He is a Senior Partner, Global Digital Health at FINN Partners, a marketing agency in New York where he focuses on all things digital for clients.

Inspired by movies in the 80’s and 90’s, Shawn has been reaching towards the dream of the hologram for over 20 years. Shawn got his start with a classic laser interference pattern holographic studio he built in high school, followed by training in advanced holographic film techniques at MIT. He has been awarded dozens of patents around the world, the Popular Mechanics Breakthrough Award, and noted as one of the ‘20 Best Brains Under 40’ by Discover Magazine.

Shawn works between Brooklyn and Hong Kong where he serves as co-founder and CEO of Looking Glass Factory.

content.rendered: Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps. She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all – fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

content.rendered: Tom is recognized as one of the world’s leading thought leaders in augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR) & wearable technology. A pioneer in this space, Tom has over a decade-long track record of running tech teams and providing strategic direction in emerging technologies for powerhouse brands and organizations. As VP of Product at 8th Wall, Tom is leading the strategy and development of powerful tools used by developers to create reality content (WebAR and WebVR) for the browser. He also played a critical role in building the AR/VR ecosystem as founder of We Are Wearables and co-producer of AWE, the world’s #1 AR+VR event series.

content.rendered: Eren Aksu is an AR/VR Subject Matter Expert and Senior Manager at Deloitte Digital. He brings together technical product management, sales and business development, marketing, strategy and production management experiences focused on the xR industry. His previous projects include dozens of virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality launches and releases in collaboration with companies like Google, Facebook, WSJ, SoCal Edison, Chevron and other global brands. Mr. Aksu has been in the xR space since 2011 and joined Deloitte in 2018 after his role at Emblematic as the 2nd full time employee helping the startup scale exponentially. He helped bootstrap Emblematic with its founders at the Interactive Media Research Lab at USC and was selected as 1 of 10 “VR for Good” film makers by Facebook/Oculus for Facebook’s inaugural “VR for Good” program. The resulting xR film became part of the official selection for SXSW (South by South West) and several other film festivals around the world. After joining Deloitte in 2018, he was selected by Deloitte\’s CIO to lead the Deloitte Digital Reality (DxR) incubation and innovation hub reporting directly to the Deloitte CIO and CTO, and he now serves the US Navy as the AR Lead for their 5G Navy Smart Warehouse project in San Diego. Mr. Aksu also leads multiple innovation related efforts at Deloitte, such as helping build out and leading content/frontier tech asset curation for Deloitte’s Houston Innovation Center focused on Energy, Resources, and Industrials. He is a frequent speaker and presenter on xR topics at events and conferences globally and is an Advisor at Deloitte’s Startup Deloitte program focused on fostering startup innovation inside Deloitte. He has an extensive network of startups and companies he collaborates with and is also the Co-Founder of Nextopic, a virtual conference series focused on introducing frontier technologies and their impacts on different higher-level topics to audiences around the world. Some of their recent conferences have included Nextopic: Future of Pandemics and Nextopic: Future of Work, which have featured dozens of speakers and thought leaders such as Salman Khan, Founder & CEO of Khan Academy.

Chris Duffey spearheads Adobe’s Creative Cloud strategic development experience design partnerships across the creative enterprise space. Chris’ keynotes have received over 50 million impressions. His sessions have been reported around the world including Access Hollywood, Extra, Ok Magazine, Hello, People, and The Guardian. In addition, his work has been featured by more than 100 global media outlets on topics including generative experience design, computational creativity, the role of human and machine and AI enhanced creativity.

Prior to Adobe, Chris was an Executive Creative Director having been a creative consultant with over 35 advertising agencies across the major global holding companies: WPP, IPG, Havas, Omnicom, Publicis and MDC.

Chris also serves on The Board of Directors for the Association of National Advertisers NY (ANA) and The Consumer Technology Association (CTA) Board of Industry Leaders.

Chris is author of the award-winning book Superhuman Innovation, the world’s first book co-authored by AI about AI.

Conceptual artist who creates multilayered installations, performances, and experiences with the express intent of elevating his audience to a sublime state. Challenging the relationship between art and spectator Morris’ work is typically equal parts technical, playful, inventive and rich with depth. From Le Louvre to Lady Gaga from Cirque Du Soleil to the Metropolitan Opera, his work has been praised by NY Times, Wall Street Journal, LA Times, Rolling Stone, NBC, VICE, Wired…. Highlight works include; *[NOWHERE](http://www.urnowhere.com/)*, reimagining online gathering; [*Reflecting the Stars*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=reflecting-the-stars), recreating the night sky in the Hudson River; [Choreographing Nine Inch Nails](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=nine-inch-nails-festival-tour) Festival Tour; [*Pixel Forest*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=pixel-forest), voice-illuminated balloon forest; [*The Wedge*](https://thewindmillfactory.com/portfolio/interactive-art-installation-burning-man-wedge/), a legendary slide/aerial-performance-center at Burning Man.

In addition to founding [The Windmill Factory](http://www.thewindmillfactory.com), Jon has performed and created with Fuerzabruta, Cirque du Soleil, The MET, Theatre de la Jeune Lune, Patrice Chereau, Robert Wilson, Tina Landau, Aszure Barton, Spymonkey, Diavolo Dance Theatre, Ken Roht’s Orphean Circus, Fabulous Monsters and Jay Scheib.  He has been featured in films by Jonathan Dayton and Valari Faris, David Michalek, and Anson Mount and starred in various national commercials and innumerable embarrassing gigs.

He has been a Thomas J. Watson Fellow, Kinnernet-Europe Experience Director, LaMaMa ETC Artist in residence, Watermill Center Fellow, Tennessee Williams Fellow, NCAA Post Graduate Scholar, 6-time All-American Springboard Diver, and holds a B.A. from the University of the South, Sewanee.  Jon has taught master classes at Harvard, NYU, Columbia, Pace, The University of The South, Vanderbilt.

After completing his Master\’s degree in Media Design at HEAD in Geneva and being a researcher in Interaction Design at ENSAD in Paris; Jérémie Lasnier co-founded LiveLike to build immersive sports streaming experiences in VR, mobile, and web, endorsed both by the NFL and TechCrunch. As Chief Creative Officer, He pushed the boundaries of innovation by overseeing all aspects of the design from implementing interfaces, 3D environments to mixed reality augmentations. He worked with major TV channels such as Fox Sports, France TV, and SKY to broadcast the biggest events of the world like the World Cup, the Superbowl, and the final of the Champion\’s League.
Jérémie won multiple international awards such as a Samsung Design Award, VR Award, and a Gold Award at the Oculus Mobile VR Jam. He also joined the prestigious 30 under 30 Forbes List class of 2017.
In 2020, LiveLike\’s VR product got acquired by Cosm, a global company focused on design, technology, and innovation to deliver the best immersive experiences to partners around the world. Jérémie joined the leadership team as VP, Immersive Design.

LarryR/Cube3 has pioneered many of the current disciplines in \”digital media\” known as XR/ VR / AR 3DUX. UI, Experience Design,Transmedia and Immersive media.

LarryR/Cube3 has over two decades of experience as a leader in the area of virtual worlds , transmedia IP creation, Virtual Reality content, Virtual IP Law, social games, online 3D, human machine interface, Augmented Reality and networked communities for both entertainment and corporate media uses. Over the years LarryR/Cube3 has worked with over hundreds of 2D /3D software tools makers or services in all matters of finding customers and creating products and services and then forming communities and ecosystems around them.

LarryR/Cube3 has spoken at industry events for over two decades. Highlights include self created seminars at Apple Computers NYC, Siggraphs for many years, Macworlds, and Digital Hollywood Panels as well as local east and west coast tech/design shows/meetings and conferences. Work and projects of LarryR/Cube3 have been written about in both print and online in periodicals such as WIRED, UploadVR, NEW MEDIA, Macworld, CNET, and two zillion blogs. He also founded the early VR Groups for developers and designers. The NYVRMLSIG, the SFWEB3D.
Currently CubeXR is creating an online web3D Educational Community and Platform www ArdadiaVirtual.com

Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

meta.talk_title: Passion and Purpose: The Deep Wellsprings of XR Inspiration
meta.talk_description: Where do the ideas for outstanding XR projects come from? What motivations and individual histories are at play to spark these projects? And what reasons do creators have for choosing immersive technologies to express their vision? A few examples will start to answer these questions, and maybe inspire you to look deep for your own creative passions.

I’m a multidisciplinary POC artist from Kentucky. I’m a VR enthusiast and a life long creative. When I was a kid I used to make houses out of paper, when I was a teen I played a copious amount of The Sims, when I went to college I started my art business doing professional photography, graphic design, web design, painting and illustration.

It wasn’t until 2020 that I discovered a love for digital 3D modeling. Exploring social apps on the Oculus Quest during the pandemic, I was immediately drawn to building worlds for people to socialize in.
In the past 12 months I have created and shared over 150 originally crafted VR templates and there are over 2,100 worlds that have my signature on them.

I design all of my environments, structures and furnishings from scratch, having no previous experience in 3D or VR before the joining Altspace. I am the first world builder to successfully monetize templates via Patreon memberships, with over 200 Patrons since November of 2020. I’ve paved the way for other artists in the space to get paid and I teach dozens of aspiring world builders daily and free of charge. Having hosted over 50 events in Altspace, I’ve also introduced countless users to the platform.

I have worked with several notable organizations within VR, such as Naughty by Nature, Public Enemy, The Harlem Film House, BRCvr, DreamlandXR and NFT Oasis and many of my colleagues have as well.

content.rendered: Catherine D. Henry is a leading voice in XR and one of the top women covering augmented reality, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence –– combining futurism with creative technology and strategic implementation. Catherine is SVP Growth at Media.Monks, where she advises leading global brands on how to enter the Metaverse; a new era of brand virtualization with innovative ideas and cutting edge technology, from enterprise to entertainment. Catherine decodes technology and interactive experiences to help companies become more resilient, efficient, and productive. With a career spanning nearly 20 years in global financial services leading institutional sales for private and equity tech investments, Catherine enables teams to better communicate, collaborate and create with tech –– no matter where they are. Catherine D. Henry is a Black female tech geek & AfroFuturist who holds an MBA, MA in economics, and speaks five languages. She did post-graduate work in immersive media & VR Film making at NY Film Academy (2016).

content.rendered:
James is a well respected leader in the immersive technology sector. He has extensive experience in delivering enterprise VR solutions to major global firms, which stretches back to the launch of the first Oculus headset in 2013 – where he helped Shell roll-out a global VR programme. As CMO at Immerse, he helped grow its enterprise VR platform into an award winning market leader, working with clients such as BP, DHL and Nestle.

He went on to set up XRTech Marketing, a consultancy focused on helping end-user companies to identify the right immersive technology solutions, as well as enabling suppliers to ensure their product positioning fits with the needs of the market. James has also become a regular speaker at industry events and an advisor to investment companies, as well as an industry writer and Co-chair of the VRAR Association.

content.rendered:
Recognizing VR\’s potential to profoundly disrupt the way humans learn, play, work and share experiences. Chris shifted focus in 2013 from a 20 year career in behavioral health to focus exclusively on the reinvigorated modern consumer VR movement and global development community to better understand and prepare for the evolution of experiential communication.

Chris is known for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of immersive tech, experiencing a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for leading Virtual Reality tech blog, Road to VR, co-founder of the Utah VR group, Ambassador for Edge of Discovery, Siggraph judge and ongoing speaker and consultant.

Chris worked on persistent virtual identity systems and methods while Director of VR/AR at Morph 3D/Tafi, founded Digital Realities XR consultant company and now dedicates his time helping helping enterprise and educational institutions learn how to leverage the strengths of collaborative VR across a variety of use cases in his business development role at Immersive VR Education, makers of the ENGAGE collaboration, training, education and events platform.

content.rendered:
Alex spent 10 years in the games industry with Codemasters before starting RiVR in 2015.

We started making 360 videos for car manufacturers and holiday brands all around the world which led us to create some software to synchronise all the virtual reality headset together. RiVR link is the software that came out of those projects and is now being used all over the world for training in all industries particularly first responders.

RiVR has also created photo realistic fire and crime scene investigation scenarios (RiVR investigate) for UK and US governments and we now see the software being used in multiple sectors.

as we look to the future we are growing our scanning techniques and pipelines allowing us to create two-dimensional documentary series which incorporates 6° of freedom photorealistic room scale virtual reality as well!

Step inside is the new platform we are creating to allow people to go that next step with a documentary film or TV series.

content.rendered: WILL CHERRY is a director, designer, and technologist specializing in the combination of hemorrhaging-edge technology with story-driven interaction design. His career creating 360 and realtime VR/AR experiences for companies like Samsung, AT&T, Apple, and more stem from a love of human-centered immersive design principles. A Swiss-army-knife of a person, his technical skillset spans AAA game and film production disciplines to drive creative solutions for any medium. His unending passion: using technology to both create art and improve the human condition through experience – be it digital, physical, or the juxtaposition of the two.

Juliana Loh is a Creative Producer with solid art, composition and design skills; an instructor with a gift for facilitating and using human centric design principles to solve problems; a
storyteller who brings thoughtfulness to social awareness and cultural
campaigns; an immersive artist who translates concepts and stories through Google Tiltbrush paintings and an in-world VR designer who has created unique and beautiful metaworlds within social VR. Juliana is an entrepreneur who views all things with a business/problem-solving mindset and a curiosity for understanding and clarifying conceptual processes. She draws from more than a decade of brand entertainment and design experiences and has recently designed visually stunning narrative centred XR pieces for Burning Man VR 2021, VIFF, HIFF and QLD XR Festival.

Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\’s Globe Theatre. His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks. Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

content.rendered:
James Jensen is an entrepreneur committed to working with leading-edge technology and eager to solve
problems surrounding how we interact and engage with each other in physical and virtual worlds. He is
the previous creator and co-founder of the world-renowned virtual reality company The VOID. Within
the last 25 years, James founded and managed several technology companies in video streaming, social
networks, mobile games, and creative services. He has partnered with Disney, Sony Entertainment, FOX,
MGM, Intel, Microsoft, SyFy, Dreamworks, and MTV through those ventures.
He is now launching a new form of virtual reality, called hyper reality, in the form of the multi-sensory
entertainment company JUMP. JUMP will allow people to come as close to jumping and flying as the
real thing, but without all of the risk.

content.rendered: Space Popular is directed by Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg, both alumni of the Architectural Association in London (2011). They founded the practice in Bangkok (2013) and have been based in London since 2016. Space Popular creates spaces, objects, and events in both physical and virtual space, concentrating on how the two realms can blend together. The studio has completed buildings, exhibitions, public artworks, furniture collections, and interiors across Asia and Europe, as well as virtual architecture for the immersive internet. Clients, collaborators, and commissioners include national institutions such as MAXXI – National Museum of 21st Century Art, Rome, Italy; The Swedish Centre for Architecture and Design –ArkDes, Stockholm, Sweden; Royal Institute of British Architects, London, UK; National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Seoul, South Korea; as well as independent galleries such as MAGAZIN, Vienna, Austria; and Sto Werkstatt, London, UK. Lesmes and Hellberg both have extensive academic experience having taught architectural design studio since 2011, first at INDA, Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok, since 2016 at the Architectural Association in London, and since 2020 at Daniels, Faculty of Architecture, University of Toronto. Their current MArch design and research studio at Daniels investigates visions for civic architecture in the immersive internet.

Perspectives include WebXR success stories, lessons learned, persona alignment, communication, and collaboration to ensure successful business outcomes.

The WebXR Design Summit introduces applications of spatial computing to interactive storytelling and the user design experience. 


The world’s WebXR experts, 3D designers, and marketers will share design principles and best practices for immersive technologies. In order to reap the benefits of WebXR, professionals need to know how to create content for the medium, and the Design Summit will show the way. 


Spatial design is still new. Attendees at the summit will learn key tools, design considerations for 3D, and spatial thinking. Attendees will hear about WebXR success stories, common pitfalls to avoid, and design tips

excerpt.rendered: “There’s gold in them thar hills.” Some startups have died crossing the prairies and mountains on the way to the promised land, while others have prospered and seized market share by building for the future. So much opportunity still lies ahead.

title.rendered: Removing Friction to Reaching Consumers and Customers

content.rendered: Taking an “Immersive First” approach to UX Design is necessary to attain and keep the engagement of the mass consumer market entering XR, requiring a complete rethink of sales to production pipelines with new creative and technical challenges.

excerpt.rendered: Taking an “Immersive First” approach to UX Design is necessary to attain and keep the engagement of the mass consumer market entering XR, requiring a complete rethink of sales to production pipelines with new creative and technical challenges.

title.rendered: Selling the Matrix: Communicating the Business Case

content.rendered: Morpheus said it best, “You cannot be told what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself.”  Onboarding decision-makers to XR and convincing them of the urgency to wrap their head around the business potential of the medium of the 21st Century.

excerpt.rendered: Morpheus said it best, “You cannot be told what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself.”  Onboarding decision-makers to XR and convincing them of the urgency to wrap their head around the business potential of the medium of the 21st Century.

title.rendered: PaaS, SaaS, and Native Browser Support

content.rendered: These business models for delivering WebXR solutions to customers each have a different cost-benefit analysis. This is an explanation for decision makers on how to navigate the ecosystem by choosing what makes the most sense for them based on their use cases.

excerpt.rendered: Racing to market with a lack of standards has created fragmentation as innovators that have built business models that lock customers into proprietary solutions. Adapting to and supporting standards is the key to survival.

content.rendered: Fostering Cooperation Across the Ecosystem to Accelerate Investment in the Immersive Web

excerpt.rendered: Fostering Cooperation Across the Ecosystem to Accelerate Investment in the Immersive Web

content.rendered: The rising tide lifts all boats when competitors can agree on specifications. We’re advocating for the adoption of the WebXR Specification to become a standard to allow developers to run experiences that are compatible across browser platforms.

excerpt.rendered: The rising tide lifts all boats when competitors can agree on specifications. We’re advocating for the adoption of the WebXR Specification to become a standard to allow developers to run experiences that are compatible across browser platforms.

content.rendered: The ability to take payments and conduct transactions securely on the Immersive Web isn’t in place yet but is essential to its growth. Blockchain and cryptocurrency, enablers of NFTs, offer new solutions to the next generation of e-commerce.

excerpt.rendered: The ability to take payments and conduct transactions securely on the Immersive Web isn’t in place yet but is essential to its growth. Blockchain and cryptocurrency, enablers of NFTs, offer new solutions to the next generation of e-commerce.

content.rendered: Saying Metaverses is like saying Internets, there can be only one.  Initiatives are underway to standardize travel between worlds, reducing friction and increasing freedom for virtual travelers. Interoperability is what will make the Metaverse a success.

excerpt.rendered: Initiatives are underway to standardize travel between worlds, reducing friction and increasing freedom for virtual travelers.

title.rendered: Anticipating Disruption, Let History Be Our Guide

content.rendered: The lessons of Web 1.0 and Web 2.0 should be fresh in our memory and applied to the foundation of the Immersive Web.

excerpt.rendered: The lessons of Web 1.0 and Web 2.0 should be fresh in our memory and applied to the foundation of the Immersive Web.

content.rendered: Billions have been invested and the hardware is coming. But when it gets here, will consumers have content? It’s time for the creative industries to match investment and have a plan to be ready to meet the coming demand.

excerpt.rendered: Billions have been invested and the hardware is coming. But when it gets here, will consumers have content? It’s time for the creative industries to match investment and have a plan to be ready to meet the coming demand.

content.rendered: Creating Places for Users to Go and Giving them Something to Do, Together

excerpt.rendered: Creating Places for Users to Go and Giving them Something to Do, Together

content.rendered: The opportunity to create realities that aren’t modeled on what’s familiar or possible lies In a network of worlds where time and physics don’t apply.  Imagination becomes your superpower, unbound by conventional thinking

excerpt.rendered: The opportunity to create realities that aren’t modeled on what’s familiar or possible lies In a network of worlds where time and physics don’t apply.  Imagination becomes your superpower, unbound by conventional thinking

title.rendered: Polygons are the New “Expensive” – Optimizing for Scalability

content.rendered: Realism comes at a cost measured in framerates. Striking the balance between quality and performance while creating content-rich compelling experiences with that people want to enjoy and share with others is key.

excerpt.rendered: Realism comes at a cost measured in framerates. Striking the balance between quality and performance while creating content-rich compelling experiences with that people want to enjoy and share with others is key.

title.rendered: Beyond the Uncanny Valley – Likeable Avatars and Metahumans

content.rendered: Between cartoons and photorealism lies the ”Uncanny Valley“ where people get creeped-out by faux-to realistic images that fail to do a good job of representing living creatures. What does and doesn’t make us feel comfortable around avatars?

excerpt.rendered: Between cartoons and photorealism lies the ”Uncanny Valley“ where people get creeped-out by faux-to realistic images that fail to do a good job of representing living creatures. What does and doesn’t make us feel comfortable around avatars?

content.rendered: New Lingo and Approaches to Creating Meaningful Experiences and Interactions

excerpt.rendered: New Lingo and Approaches to Creating Meaningful Experiences and Interactions

content.rendered: From 2D to 3D to Immersive across all display types.

excerpt.rendered: Oh, you mean a menu? Why didn’t you say so! When presenting a user with options in Six Degrees of Freedom by projecting holographic buttons in front of them, ergonomics counts. Here we consider menu design for various input methods at once.

title.rendered: Designing for multiple input types across devices

content.rendered: Now that we’ve reinvented the menu, let’s talk about managing the user’s journey from legacy keyboard and mouse input, to touch screens to controllers, hand tracking, gaze pointers, rings and gesture recognition for a wholistic look at next-gen user interfaces.

excerpt.rendered: Now that we’ve reinvented the menu, let’s talk about managing the user’s journey from legacy keyboard and mouse input, to touch screens to controllers, hand tracking, gaze pointers, rings and gesture recognition for a wholistic look at next-gen user interfaces.

content.rendered: The secret to compelling and beautiful experiences is in applying properties to objects that reflect color and provide detail, while being mindful of processing overhead. Here we reveal the tricks that pros use to produce highly performant wow factor.

excerpt.rendered: The secret to compelling and beautiful experiences is in applying properties to objects that reflect color and provide detail, while being mindful of processing overhead. Here we reveal the tricks that pros use to produce highly performant wow factor.

content.rendered: Interactivity is the key to unlocking Spatial Memory, and Immersive Websites transition us from passive consumption to active participation. Through doing we become experienced, increasing retention. This is why we call them experiences.

excerpt.rendered: Interactivity is the key to unlocking Spatial Memory, and Immersive Websites transition us from passive consumption to active participation. Through doing we become experienced, increasing retention. This is why we call them experiences.

excerpt.rendered: XR Represents the most significant need for professional upskilling since print went digital

title.rendered: Marketing Makeovers -Adapting Your Brand for the 3D Web

content.rendered: It’s not just adding a z-axis. When the immersive Web becomes ubiquitous, your existing branding will fall flat, literally. The time to start adapting and experimenting is now, before your next-gen content is in front of an audience of millions with high expectations.

excerpt.rendered: It’s not just adding a z-axis. When the immersive Web becomes ubiquitous, your existing branding will fall flat, literally. The time to start adapting and experimenting is now, before your next-gen content is in front of an audience of millions with high expectations.

content.rendered: When moving around in Virtual Worlds and around holograms projected in the real world, you are the camera, and sensors determine your proximity to virtual objects and your ability to interact with them. Understanding these functions is important.

excerpt.rendered: When moving around in Virtual Worlds and around holograms projected in the real world, you are the camera, and sensors determine your proximity to virtual objects and your ability to interact with them. Understanding these functions is important.

content.rendered: Not all 3D Formats are created equal, and each have their own technical benefits and limitations. It is essential to understand the value of each and to choose which media type best serves the experience you are designing for.

excerpt.rendered: Not all 3D Formats are created equal, and each have their own technical benefits and limitations. It is essential to understand the value of each and to choose which media type best serves the experience you are designing for.

content.rendered: Presentation of spatial content is more nuanced than on the flat web. Support for features such as videos and menus has new technical challenges and benefits. Understanding how these pieces fit together is essential to architecting compelling experiences.

items.title: WebXR Business Summit – September 14
items.content:
Thank you for participating in the WebXR Business Summit hosted by Samantha Mathews on September 14, 2021

Stay tuned for the launch of the individual videos, coming soon.

The summit featured WebXR business leaders and pioneers sharing their knowledge of and experience with immersive technologies, which are already producing ROI through work efficiencies, improved performances, and a sustainable global footprint. 

Perspectives include WebXR success stories, lessons learned, persona alignment, communication, and collaboration to ensure successful business outcomes.  

Galaxy Sponsor

We encourage you to join the community by coming to the watch parties hosted on SEVEN different platforms for this event! Thank you to all the people that helped make this possible.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO/CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO/CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Alban Denoyel
items.content: Alban Denoyel is the co-founder of Sketchfab, the leading platform to publish and find 3D content online, now part of Epic Games. Prior to Sketchfab, he worked for 4 years in the 2D world of photography. He loves making 3D content with photogrammetry or VR sculpting. He graduated from ESSEC Business School (Paris, France).

items.title: WebXR at the European Parliament and UNICEF Innovation Fund Startups
Fabien Bénétou
items.content: Fabien Bénétou is a WebXR freelance developer currently working for UNICEF and the European Parliament. Based in Brussels, Belgium, Fabien is a Mozilla AFrame contributor driven by the need to make virtual and augmented reality understandable by anybody curious enough to try. He has organized events, given talks and lead dozens of professional workshops all around the world. His focus goes beyond the technology to the positive impact it can offer through privacy conscious methods to bring VR and AR innovations to the most wide possible audience. He is convinced that XR will become useful once used and challenged by the most diverse audience.

items.title: Building Industry Consensus around Standards
items.content: The rising tide lifts all boats when competitors can agree on specifications. We’re advocating for the adoption of the WebXR Specification to become a standard to allow developers to run experiences that are compatible across browser platforms.

items.title: Yu Yuan
items.content: Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality. Dedicated to \"Creating Better Worlds\" as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM\'s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members. He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

items.title: Neil Trevett
items.content: Neil works at NVIDIA to help developers use GPUs and is involved with open standards to help the industry move forward so we can all see what comes next sooner. The metaverse has been a long-term inspiration, even if he didn’t realize it at the time.
