He has helped OpenGL onto PCs, served as President of the Web3D Consortium, and as Khronos President has been involved in the creation of multiple widely adopted standards for 3D and XR including OpenGL ES, WebGL, Vulkan, SPIR-V, glTF and OpenXR.

items.title: Atsushi Shimono
items.content:
Working as W3C/Keio team staff from 2018, on internationalization (especially on Japanese), immersive-web (WebXR), and Timed-Text.
Interested in advanced Web technologies, and organizing Web or open source related communities in Japan from 2005.
PhD (Science/Astrophysics)

items.title: Daniel Ljunggren
items.content: Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

items.title: Selling the Matrix: Communicating the Business Case
items.content: Morpheus said it best, “You cannot be told what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself.”  Onboarding decision-makers to XR and convincing them of the urgency to wrap their head around the business potential of the medium of the 21st Century.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den.  I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: Veronica Orvalho
items.content: Verónica Orvalho is the founder and CEO of Didimo. She has translated years of research, data science, and computer graphics expertise into a patented technology platform to create digital humans, empowering people to engage more authentically and humanly in digital spaces. This breakthrough provides the next evolution of how humans will engage the world around them. Veronica earned a Ph.D. in Computer Graphics and is a professor at Porto University. She has lived and worked on three continents, with companies like IBM, Sony, Amazon, Universal Studios, and more.

items.title: Terry Proto
items.content: Experienced entrepreneur with a professional background in creative media in the US, Europe, and Asia. In 2015, when VR/AR exploded onto the scene, Terry saw the potential in a growing creative market whose professionals would need help with strategic and business development advice. Since then Terry founded his XR Business Consulting agency, Ubereal, and the leading VR/AR directory and showcase: VirtualRealityMarketing.com

items.title: Jason Lovell
items.content:
Jason Lovell, PwC UK Head of XR Strategy

Jason\'s overriding focus is on helping clients across multiple industries understand, quantify, and implement the benefits of virtual reality and augmented reality technology, with a focus on deriving clear return on investment.

Passionate about articulating the real business value of emerging technologies, Jason has significant experience across consumer electronics & innovation in a variety of senior roles, including managing VR for Samsung UK, founding his own XR consultancy \'Captivate\', and managing EMEA brand partnerships for Jaunt XR.

items.title: Emilios Eracleous
items.content: Emilios Eracleous is the Specialist XR Recruiter & Co-Founder of Immersive Search, where he provides exceptional XR talent to businesses across the globe. Currently, his main focus is on addressing the skills gap in XR, by building a global network of talent and connecting them to the organizations that need them. Emilios is a senior recruitment professional, who has a demonstrated track record of successfully delivering recruitment and retention solutions to a diverse client range, including industry leading organisations and start-ups.

items.title: Christopher Lafayette
items.content:
Christopher Lafayette is an emergent technologist in XR applying his talents to Medtech, FinTech, Climate and applied sciences.

He is working for a more equitable future in technology serving as a Silicon Valley national and international speaker, thought leader and a culture advocate.

items.title: Alex Howland
items.content:
Alex Howland, Ph.D., is president and co-founder of Virbela, a virtual world platform for remote work, learning, and events. Howland created Virbela in 2012, before it was purchased and made public by eXp World Holdings in 2018.

Virbela’s mission is to help organizations and people thrive in a remote-first future. Alex leads the development of Virbela’s products and services -- continuing to expand the platform to accommodate not just business workspaces, but classrooms, event spaces, and recreational areas as well.

Prior to co-founding Virbela, Howland was an instructor in the Psychology Department at University of California, San Diego, where he taught Industrial and Organizational Psychology to undergraduate students. His expertise in organizational psychology gives him a unique perspective on creating virtual work and education spaces. He designed Virbela specifically to create a unique virtual experience where users feel psychologically safe and are more likely to collaborate, brainstorm, and succeed.

Howland has a bachelor of science in psychology from Providence College, and his Ph.D. in organizational psychology from Alliant International University, San Diego.

items.title: Vivian Chan
items.content: Vivian is the CEO of Red Threads and former Global Head of Digital Sales at NexTech AR Solutions, one Canada's fastest-growing publicly traded technology companies in digital experience and augmented reality. With 20 years of experience creating monetization strategies for emerging technology, she has helped scale three high-growth startups and served on the merger & acquisitions committee at VMware. Vivian is a lauded Ecosystem builder — she is Globe and Mail’s Top 50 Executive and a YWCA Women of Distinction Nominee in 2021.

items.title: PaaS, SaaS, and Native Browser Support
items.content: These business models for delivering WebXR solutions to customers each have a different cost-benefit analysis. This is an explanation for decision makers on how to navigate the ecosystem by choosing what makes the most sense for them based on their use cases.

items.title: Nisha Burton
items.content:
As the CMO and Co-Founder of Reflective Brands, Nisha has a robust collection of skills pertaining to the media industry, digital marketing, and branding. Nisha specializes in helping companies elevate their brand identity and accomplish their goals through custom immersive experiences using VR/AR, strategic branding, and transmedia marketing. She is also a skilled filmmaker and currently she serves on the executive board of the OMPA the top trade organization for media production professionals in Oregon.

With over 15 years of experience in this field, Nisha brings expertise in utilizing the power of storytelling and cutting-edge technologies to get exceptional marketing results.

items.title: Caspar Thykier
items.content:
Caspar Thykier is the co-founder and CEO of Zappar, an augmented reality platform and creative studio on a mission to democratize immersive technology.

Caspar and the Zappar team have been pioneers in the AR space for the last decade and have worked with the world’s leading brands to deploy innovative and market-leading AR solutions across the mobile web and native apps.

Prior to founding Zappar, Caspar spent 15 years as an account director and managing director of major advertising agencies, including one where he was a founding partner.

items.title: Ben Morrow
items.content: Ben is a passionate product leader for Augmented Reality and boundary mediums in general. His experience spans Interactive Television, Gaming, Experiential entertainment, Lightfield VR and Augmented Reality.

items.title: Nick Mountford
items.content: Nick provides strategic leadership to clients and the production team across Dreamwave and Active Theory projects.

items.title: Artur Sychov Live from Somnium Space
Artur Sychov
items.content: Artur Sychov is Founder and CEO of Somnium Space. He has been navigating virtual worlds for more than two decades starting with Ultima Online in 1999, then Second Life and many more. Artur strongly believes in the ultimate future of Virtual Reality worlds with open and decentralized economy.

items.title: Immersive E-Commerce and Crypto-Economic Infrastructure
items.content: The ability to take payments and conduct transactions securely on the Immersive Web isn’t in place yet but is essential to its growth. Blockchain and cryptocurrency, enablers of NFTs, offer new solutions to the next generation of e-commerce.

items.title: Luke Mulks
items.content: With experience in several startups, publishing and ad products, Luke was well equipped to join Brave in 2016 to begin developing new business models with privacy and blockchain. A co-author of the Basic Attention Token white paper, and core BAT team member Luke leads Business Operations at Brave and BAT, bringing new solutions to market that include privacy by default, backed with the benefits and empowerment that blockchain brings to web3.

items.title: Amy Peck
items.content:
Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all - fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

items.title: Jamie Burke
items.content: Jamie is the CEO and founder of Outlier Ventures. He was an early investor in Bitcoin and Ethereum and founded Outlier Ventures, the Web 3.0 startup accelerator, in 2014. He is an active collector of NFTs and a passionate proponent of the Open Metaverse theory (you can read the thesis: https://outlierventures.io/research/the-open-metaverse-os/). The Open Metaverse thesis was created early 2021 after months of development, and acts as a toolkit to design alternatives based on principles of user centricity and sovereignty of identity, data and wealth. Jamie is an active media commentator and has spoken on stages across the world about the breadth of opportunity Ethereum posses to serve as the foundation for the next generation of the internet. He is an active collector of NFTs, co-founding 100xARt, a community of the Top 200 collectors and has helped launch the world\'s first d-zine, NFTs.WTF, an independent NFT media property owned and controlled by a DAO of 100 industry leaders, creatives and influencers.

items.title: Leveraging Digital Twins For Businesses in Africa via WebXR
Arome Ibrahim
items.content:
Arome Ibrahim is an Immersive 360°VR Developer, Geographer & Applied Meteorologist, environmentalist, XR for Good advocate, a social innovator who strongly believes in utilizing technology, more broadly innovation to build and grow impact-based solutions in Africa.

He is the co-founder of Experis Immersive - an Extended Reality (XR) content development startup creating immersive, innovative, and interactive experiences.

Arome is also the team lead at Immersive Tech Africa, a creative social enterprise that leverage Extended Reality (XR) technologies like Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented reality (AR), 360VR to create impact-driven experiences and solutions that inspire global action towards the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Arome has been recognized as a virtual reality technology innovator by the Next Economy program, awarded the Next Economy Entrepreneurship Hero and the Next Economy Impact Award made possible by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

His project, Virtuality Africa - a virtual museum of contemporary arts in Africa, was selected for the Digital Lab Africa #5 XR category project award.

He is currently an active volunteer with several industry organizations, including Google Street View, Google AR/VR, VR AR MR, AR/VR Africa, International Virtual Reality Professionals Association, Young Sustainable Impact, WebXR, Earthpreneurs, YALI Africa, SDG Nigeria, XR4ALL, Tourism 4.0, Tourism for SDGs, Royal African Young Innovators.

Arome firmly believes that immersive technology has an influential role in the future development of Africa and is committed to making this happen.

items.title: Where the WebXR Business Opportunities are Hiding
items.content:
- mid market companies
- security/vendor approvals
- leveraging already deployed services
- data privacy

items.title: Danny Stefanic
items.content: Danny Stefanic is the creator of the world\'s first metaverse-for-business platform, spawning both MootUp for virtual events and LearnBrite for simulation and training. He is the inventor of the first 3D metaverse ExitReality, founder of the International Virtual Reality Association and chairman of the virtual worlds social network Koinup. Called a "visionary" by his peers and deemed by Wall Street CIOs and Silicon Valley VCs to be "one of the pioneers in his field", he has been creating ground-breaking 3D businesses for over 29 years. Danny actively works with young businesses to share his experiences and give back to the community. He has assisted companies with angel investment, international licensing, acquisitions, exits, managing distributed teams and has personally closed IP acquisitions valued at $85MM.

items.title: Roadmap to WebXR Adoption
items.content: Billions have been invested and the hardware is coming. But when it gets here, will consumers have content? It’s time for the creative industries to match investment and have a plan to be ready to meet the coming demand.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO/CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content: Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps. She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.title: Jon Morris
items.content:
Conceptual artist who creates multilayered installations, performances, and experiences with the express intent of elevating his audience to a sublime state. Challenging the relationship between art and spectator Morris’ work is typically equal parts technical, playful, inventive and rich with depth. From Le Louvre to Lady Gaga from Cirque Du Soleil to the Metropolitan Opera, his work has been praised by NY Times, Wall Street Journal, LA Times, Rolling Stone, NBC, VICE, Wired.... Highlight works include; *[NOWHERE](http://www.urnowhere.com/)*, reimagining online gathering; [*Reflecting the Stars*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=reflecting-the-stars), recreating the night sky in the Hudson River; [Choreographing Nine Inch Nails](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=nine-inch-nails-festival-tour) Festival Tour; [*Pixel Forest*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=pixel-forest), voice-illuminated balloon forest; [*The Wedge*](https://thewindmillfactory.com/portfolio/interactive-art-installation-burning-man-wedge/), a legendary slide/aerial-performance-center at Burning Man.

In addition to founding [The Windmill Factory](http://www.thewindmillfactory.com), Jon has performed and created with Fuerzabruta, Cirque du Soleil, The MET, Theatre de la Jeune Lune, Patrice Chereau, Robert Wilson, Tina Landau, Aszure Barton, Spymonkey, Diavolo Dance Theatre, Ken Roht’s Orphean Circus, Fabulous Monsters and Jay Scheib.  He has been featured in films by Jonathan Dayton and Valari Faris, David Michalek, and Anson Mount and starred in various national commercials and innumerable embarrassing gigs.

He has been a Thomas J. Watson Fellow, Kinnernet-Europe Experience Director, LaMaMa ETC Artist in residence, Watermill Center Fellow, Tennessee Williams Fellow, NCAA Post Graduate Scholar, 6-time All-American Springboard Diver, and holds a B.A. from the University of the South, Sewanee.  Jon has taught master classes at Harvard, NYU, Columbia, Pace, The University of The South, Vanderbilt.

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content: Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR. He\'s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Success Stories and Challenges of Early Adopters
items.content: “There’s gold in them thar hills.” Some startups have died crossing the prairies and mountains on the way to the promised land, while others have prospered and seized market share by building for the future. So much opportunity still lies ahead.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO/CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Daniel Meeks
items.content:
Daniel Meeks is an independent consultant specializing in immersive technology. His current work entails implementing augmented and virtual reality to visualize the battlespace for distributed simulator training with Battlespace Simulations, Inc.

Daniel is a former AC-130U Electronic Warfare Officer with eleven years of service in the USAF, and has ten years of experience designing, operating, and maintaining combat simulators around the world.

items.title: Tony Parisi
items.content: Head of Product Innovation, XR and E-commerce

items.title: Larry Rosenthal
items.content:
LarryR/Cube3 has pioneered many of the current disciplines in \"digital media\" known as XR/ VR / AR 3DUX. UI, Experience Design,Transmedia and Immersive media.

LarryR/Cube3 has over two decades of experience as a leader in the area of virtual worlds , transmedia IP creation, Virtual Reality content, Virtual IP Law, social games, online 3D, human machine interface, Augmented Reality and networked communities for both entertainment and corporate media uses. Over the years LarryR/Cube3 has worked with over hundreds of 2D /3D software tools makers or services in all matters of finding customers and creating products and services and then forming communities and ecosystems around them.

LarryR/Cube3 has spoken at industry events for over two decades. Highlights include self created seminars at Apple Computers NYC, Siggraphs for many years, Macworlds, and Digital Hollywood Panels as well as local east and west coast tech/design shows/meetings and conferences. Work and projects of LarryR/Cube3 have been written about in both print and online in periodicals such as WIRED, UploadVR, NEW MEDIA, Macworld, CNET, and two zillion blogs. He also founded the early VR Groups for developers and designers. The NYVRMLSIG, the SFWEB3D. 
Currently CubeXR is creating an online web3D Educational Community and Platform www ArdadiaVirtual.com

items.title: Removing Friction to Reaching Consumers and Customers
items.content: Taking an “Immersive First” approach to UX Design is necessary to attain and keep the engagement of the mass consumer market entering XR, requiring a complete rethink of sales to production pipelines with new creative and technical challenges.

items.title: Joanna Popper
items.content:
Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

items.title: Jeremy Dalton
items.content:
Jeremy is the author of Reality Check: How Immersive Technologies Can Transform Your Business, a book that anyone can pick up to better understand how virtual reality and augmented reality are being used in businesses all over the world.

He has featured in The Financial Times, The Economist, the BBC, and other media outlets. He has worked with organizations like the World Economic Forum and currently sits on the advisory board of Immerse UK to support businesses interested in immersive technologies.

items.title: Eren Aksu
items.content: Eren Aksu is an AR/VR Subject Matter Expert and Senior Manager at Deloitte Digital. He brings together technical product management, sales and business development, marketing, strategy and production management experiences focused on the xR industry. His previous projects include dozens of virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality launches and releases in collaboration with companies like Google, Facebook, WSJ, SoCal Edison, Chevron and other global brands. Mr. Aksu has been in the xR space since 2011 and joined Deloitte in 2018 after his role at Emblematic as the 2nd full time employee helping the startup scale exponentially. He helped bootstrap Emblematic with its founders at the Interactive Media Research Lab at USC and was selected as 1 of 10 “VR for Good” film makers by Facebook/Oculus for Facebook’s inaugural “VR for Good” program. The resulting xR film became part of the official selection for SXSW (South by South West) and several other film festivals around the world. After joining Deloitte in 2018, he was selected by Deloitte\'s CIO to lead the Deloitte Digital Reality (DxR) incubation and innovation hub reporting directly to the Deloitte CIO and CTO, and he now serves the US Navy as the AR Lead for their 5G Navy Smart Warehouse project in San Diego. Mr. Aksu also leads multiple innovation related efforts at Deloitte, such as helping build out and leading content/frontier tech asset curation for Deloitte’s Houston Innovation Center focused on Energy, Resources, and Industrials. He is a frequent speaker and presenter on xR topics at events and conferences globally and is an Advisor at Deloitte’s Startup Deloitte program focused on fostering startup innovation inside Deloitte. He has an extensive network of startups and companies he collaborates with and is also the Co-Founder of Nextopic, a virtual conference series focused on introducing frontier technologies and their impacts on different higher-level topics to audiences around the world. Some of their recent conferences have included Nextopic: Future of Pandemics and Nextopic: Future of Work, which have featured dozens of speakers and thought leaders such as Salman Khan, Founder & CEO of Khan Academy.

items.title: Tom Emrich
items.content: Tom is recognized as one of the world’s leading thought leaders in augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR) & wearable technology. A pioneer in this space, Tom has over a decade-long track record of running tech teams and providing strategic direction in emerging technologies for powerhouse brands and organizations. As VP of Product at 8th Wall, Tom is leading the strategy and development of powerful tools used by developers to create reality content (WebAR and WebVR) for the browser. Previous to 8th Wall, Tom was a founding partner at Super Ventures, the first VC fund dedicated to augmented reality. He also played a critical role in building the AR/VR ecosystem as founder of We Are Wearables and co-producer of AWE, the world’s #1 AR+VR event series.

items.title: Immersive Data Storytelling
items.content: A powerful set of use cases that captures the hearts and minds.

items.title: Jason Marsh
items.content: Jason Marsh is the technical founder and CEO of Flow Immersive, a company focused on Data Storytelling with WebXR. Jason is obsessed with the brain science around how we can build better mental models of our data and information, understanding the limitations of slideware, and encoding better science into a product for anyone to build data presentations.

items.title: Interoperability Across the Metaverse
items.content: Saying Metaverses is like saying Internets, there can be only one.  Initiatives are underway to standardize travel between worlds, reducing friction and increasing freedom for virtual travelers. Interoperability is what will make the Metaverse a success.

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content: Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production. Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: Robert Long
items.content: Robert is passionate about defending the open metaverse. He has worked on social VR at AltspaceVR and Mozilla Hubs. Now Robert is working at Element on decentralized communications and co-chairing the Open Metaverse Interoperability Group.

items.title: Alina Kadlubsky
items.content: Alina is an Art Director Design Researcher, WebXR Developer; Director of Communications of the Open AR Cloud Association and Managing Director of Open AR Cloud Europe gUG as well as Lead Strategist of the Cyber XR Coalition. With a passion for immersive Tech, Spatial Computing, Spatial Web and creating a human centered future of Computing.

items.title: Timmu Tõke
items.content: Timmu Tõke is the CEO of Ready Player Me, a cross-game avatar platform integrated with 400+ games and apps across the metaverse. Forbes 30 Under 30.

items.title: Anticipating Disruption, Let History Be Our Guide
items.content: The lessons of Web 1.0 and Web 2.0 should be fresh in our memory and applied to the foundation of the Immersive Web.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, one of the world’s leading virtual , augmented and mixed reality (XR) consulting & product development companies. Changing the way we teach using the MetaVRse game engine introducing 3D learning & spatial design without code.

items.title: Ritesh Patel
items.content:
Ritesh is as a digital and social evangelist who has been evangelizing digital since the early days of the dot com boom in the late 1990\'s. Early in his career, he joined Agency.com and quickly began to consult with major fortune 500 companies to evangelize the merits of the World Wide Web.

Along the way, he worked for the likes of Havas, Cushman & Wakefield and began a deep dive into the healthcare arena in 2009 when he joined Inventiv Health as Head of Digital & Innovation. There, he was a pioneer in the use of the emerging social media platforms, winning a CLIO award in 2010 for the Novartis Tobi Facebook page under the category of “Best Use of Social Media in 2010” for that work.

He is a Senior Partner, Global Digital Health at FINN Partners, a marketing agency in New York where he focuses on all things digital for clients.

items.title: Forest Gibson
items.content: Forest is a co-founder and Chief Product Officer at Pluto VR. The company’s purpose is to help humanity transcend physical location so that everyone can more easily connect, communicate, and collaborate as if they were in person regardless of where they are. Before co-founding Pluto VR he was a creative innovations leader at Deloitte Digital, working with the largest brands in the world to help them stay competitive in the new digital landscape. He has a diverse background including VR, film, marketing, and crowdfunding. Other projects Include: An automated brewing machine kickstarter that makes beer at the press of a button, a new way to train employees through mobile gaming, and the web series Know Your Meme.

items.title: Terry xR. Schussler
items.content: Terry xR. Schussler is an award-winning software designer/developer currently driving @deutschetelekom’s XR HMD initiatives as Senior Director, Spatial Computing. Terry co-produced the XRCollaboration.com website - part of his effort to inspire us to use XR technologies to improve our interactions with each other and the real world. His mission is to encourage us to move from a heads-down to a heads-up society. Terry regularly mentors innovators trying to make a difference in XR through Deutsche Telekom’s startup accelerator hub:raum and other programs.

items.title: Gabe Baker
items.content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

items.title: WebXR Design Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Design Summit introduces applications of spatial computing to interactive storytelling and the user design experience. 


The world’s WebXR experts, 3D designers, and marketers will share design principles and best practices for immersive technologies. In order to reap the benefits of WebXR, professionals need to know how to create content for the medium, and the Design Summit will show the way. 


Spatial design is still new. Attendees at the summit will learn key tools, design considerations for 3D, and spatial thinking. Attendees will hear about WebXR success stories, common pitfalls to avoid, and design tips

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content: Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR. He\'s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content: Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR. He\'s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Chris Duffey
items.content:
Chris Duffey spearheads Adobe’s Creative Cloud strategic development experience design partnerships across the creative enterprise space. Chris’ keynotes have received over 50 million impressions. His sessions have been reported around the world including Access Hollywood, Extra, Ok Magazine, Hello, People, and The Guardian. In addition, his work has been featured by more than 100 global media outlets on topics including generative experience design, computational creativity, the role of human and machine and AI enhanced creativity.

Prior to Adobe, Chris was an Executive Creative Director having been a creative consultant with over 35 advertising agencies across the major global holding companies: WPP, IPG, Havas, Omnicom, Publicis and MDC.

Chris also serves on The Board of Directors for the Association of National Advertisers NY (ANA) and The Consumer Technology Association (CTA) Board of Industry Leaders.

Chris is author of the award-winning book Superhuman Innovation, the world’s first book co-authored by AI about AI.

items.title: Passion and Purpose – The Deep Wellsprings of XR Inspiration
Jacquelyn Morie
items.content:
Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

items.title: Modeling Your Metaverse
items.content: The opportunity to create realities that aren’t modeled on what’s familiar or possible lies In a network of worlds where time and physics don’t apply.  Imagination becomes your superpower, unbound by conventional thinking

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content: Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps. She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.title: Christi Fenison
items.content:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.
By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.
Christi received her Master\'s degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

items.title: Artsy Marie
items.content:
I’m a multidisciplinary POC artist from Kentucky. I’m a VR enthusiast and a life long creative. When I was a kid I used to make houses out of paper, when I was a teen I played a copious amount of The Sims, when I went to college I started my art business doing professional photography, graphic design, web design, painting and illustration.

It wasn’t until 2020 that I discovered a love for digital 3D modeling. Exploring social apps on the Oculus Quest during the pandemic, I was immediately drawn to building worlds for people to socialize in.
In the past 12 months I have created and shared over 150 originally crafted VR templates and there are over 2,100 worlds that have my signature on them.

I design all of my environments, structures and furnishings from scratch, having no previous experience in 3D or VR before the joining Altspace. I am the first world builder to successfully monetize templates via Patreon memberships, with over 200 Patrons since November of 2020. I’ve paved the way for other artists in the space to get paid and I teach dozens of aspiring world builders daily and free of charge. Having hosted over 50 events in Altspace, I’ve also introduced countless users to the platform.

I have worked with several notable organizations within VR, such as Naughty by Nature, Public Enemy, The Harlem Film House, BRCvr, DreamlandXR and NFT Oasis and many of my colleagues have as well.

items.title: Juliana Loh
items.content:
Juliana Loh is a Creative Producer with solid art, composition and design skills; an instructor with a gift for facilitating and using human centric design principles to solve problems; a
storyteller who brings thoughtfulness to social awareness and cultural
campaigns; an immersive artist who translates concepts and stories through Google Tiltbrush paintings and an in-world VR designer who has created unique and beautiful metaworlds within social VR. Juliana is an entrepreneur who views all things with a business/problem-solving mindset and a curiosity for understanding and clarifying conceptual processes. She draws from more than a decade of brand entertainment and design experiences and has recently designed visually stunning narrative centred XR pieces for Burning Man VR 2021, VIFF, HIFF and QLD XR Festival.

items.title: Why 6DoF Matters
items.content: When moving around in Virtual Worlds and around holograms projected in the real world, you are the camera, and sensors determine your proximity to virtual objects and your ability to interact with them. Understanding these functions is important.

items.title: Chris Madsen
items.content:
Recognizing VR\'s potential to profoundly disrupt the way humans learn, play, work and share experiences. Chris shifted focus in 2013 from a 20 year career in behavioral health to focus exclusively on the reinvigorated modern consumer VR movement and global development community to better understand and prepare for the evolution of experiential communication.
 
Chris is known for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of immersive tech,  experiencing a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for leading Virtual Reality tech blog, Road to VR, co-founder of the Utah VR group, Ambassador for Edge of Discovery, Siggraph judge and ongoing speaker and consultant.

Chris worked on persistent virtual identity systems and methods while Director of VR/AR at Morph 3D/Tafi, founded Digital Realities XR consultant company and now dedicates  his time helping helping enterprise and educational institutions learn how to leverage the strengths of  collaborative VR across a variety of use cases in his business development role at Immersive VR Education, makers of the ENGAGE collaboration, training, education and events platform.

items.title: Alex Harvey
items.content:
Alex spent 10 years in the games industry with Codemasters before starting RiVR in 2015.

We started making 360 videos for car manufacturers and holiday brands all around the world which led us to create some software to synchronise all the virtual reality headset together. RiVR link is the software that came out of those projects and is now being used all over the world for training in all industries particularly first responders.

RiVR has also created photo realistic fire and crime scene investigation scenarios (RiVR investigate) for UK and US governments and we now see the software being used in multiple sectors.

as we look to the future we are growing our scanning techniques and pipelines allowing us to create two-dimensional documentary series which incorporates 6° of freedom photorealistic room scale virtual reality as well!

Step inside is the new platform we are creating to allow people to go that next step with a documentary film or TV series.

items.title: James Jensen
items.content:
James Jensen is an entrepreneur committed to working with leading-edge technology and eager to solve
problems surrounding how we interact and engage with each other in physical and virtual worlds. He is
the previous creator and co-founder of the world-renowned virtual reality company The VOID. Within
the last 25 years, James founded and managed several technology companies in video streaming, social
networks, mobile games, and creative services. He has partnered with Disney, Sony Entertainment, FOX,
MGM, Intel, Microsoft, SyFy, Dreamworks, and MTV through those ventures.
He is now launching a new form of virtual reality, called hyper reality, in the form of the multi-sensory
entertainment company JUMP. JUMP will allow people to come as close to jumping and flying as the
real thing, but without all of the risk.

items.title: Andreea Ion Cojocaru
items.content: Andreea Ion Cojocaru is a licensed architect, a software developer, and the co-founder of NUMENA, a company comprised of coding architects that both design and develop. Projects focus on spatial experiences and interactions across multiple dimensions and modalities.

items.title: Beyond the Uncanny Valley – Likeable Avatars and Metahumans
items.content: Between cartoons and photorealism lies the ”Uncanny Valley“ where people get creeped-out by faux-to realistic images that fail to do a good job of representing living creatures. What does and doesn’t make us feel comfortable around avatars?

items.title: Christina “Xaos Princess” Kinne
items.content:
Christina Kinne aka XaosPrincess graduated from Munich Filmschool in 2006.She has worked as director, first a.d., producer, editor, set designer, photographer and journalist, and has directed more than ten movies, including one of Europe’s first live-action 3D-films – “Delusion 3D” (2008).

After her parental leave Christina Kinne found a new creative home in Virtual Reality. Using software like Gravity Sketch or Tilt Brush she designs 3D models for VR in VR.Christina Kinne has produced and hosted a variety of Virtual Reality events.As evangelist she also likes to promote VR in real life – be it by screening live VR content to a RL audience or by producing educational videos.

In July 2020 Christina Kinne joined Tivoli Cloud VR as CMO and Events Manager to help making the dream of a friendly, creative and inclusive metaverse come true.Currently she is also pursuing a second MA in “Digital Narratives” at the International Filmschool Cologne.

items.title: Danny Stefanic
items.content: Danny Stefanic is the creator of the world\'s first metaverse-for-business platform, spawning both MootUp for virtual events and LearnBrite for simulation and training. He is the inventor of the first 3D metaverse ExitReality, founder of the International Virtual Reality Association and chairman of the virtual worlds social network Koinup. Called a "visionary" by his peers and deemed by Wall Street CIOs and Silicon Valley VCs to be "one of the pioneers in his field", he has been creating ground-breaking 3D businesses for over 29 years. Danny actively works with young businesses to share his experiences and give back to the community. He has assisted companies with angel investment, international licensing, acquisitions, exits, managing distributed teams and has personally closed IP acquisitions valued at $85MM.

items.title: Paige Dansinger
items.content: Paige Dansinger is the founder of Better World Museum, Horizon Art Museum, Women in Horizon, and is a Facebook Horizon VR Game Developer. Paige is recognized by Facebook as one of the Top 117 Global Community Leaders by the Facebook Community Leadership Fellowship Program. Paige has presented at the WHO, TEDx, Facebook’s Global Wellness & Safety Summit, Nobel Peace Prize, Singapore, Shenzhen, Beijing, Miami, San Francisco, and more.

items.title: Jin
items.content: Lifelong passion for decentralized and p2p technology. I\'ve been in VR since DK1 was released and building web based VR experiences for 7 years. I\'m interested in the standards and file formats that become the glue for the next version of the internet. Everyday I think about how the metaverse can be less friction and more freedom.

items.title: Marketing Makeovers -Adapting Your Brand for the 3D Web
items.content: It’s not just adding a z-axis. When the immersive Web becomes ubiquitous, your existing branding will fall flat, literally. The time to start adapting and experimenting is now, before your next-gen content is in front of an audience of millions with high expectations.

items.title: Nisha Burton
items.content:
As the CMO and Co-Founder of Reflective Brands, Nisha has a robust collection of skills pertaining to the media industry, digital marketing, and branding. Nisha specializes in helping companies elevate their brand identity and accomplish their goals through custom immersive experiences using VR/AR, strategic branding, and transmedia marketing. She is also a skilled filmmaker and currently she serves on the executive board of the OMPA the top trade organization for media production professionals in Oregon.

With over 15 years of experience in this field, Nisha brings expertise in utilizing the power of storytelling and cutting-edge technologies to get exceptional marketing results.

items.title: James Watson
items.content:
James is a well respected leader in the immersive technology sector. He has extensive experience in delivering enterprise VR solutions to major global firms, which stretches back to the launch of the first Oculus headset in 2013 – where he helped Shell roll-out a global VR programme. As CMO at Immerse, he helped grow its enterprise VR platform into an award winning market leader, working with clients such as BP, DHL and Nestle.
 
He went on to set up XRTech Marketing, a consultancy focused on helping end-user companies to identify the right immersive technology solutions, as well as enabling suppliers to ensure their product positioning fits with the needs of the market. James has also become a regular speaker at industry events and an advisor to investment companies, as well as an industry writer and Co-chair of the VRAR Association.

items.title: Catherine Henry
items.content: Catherine D. Henry is a leading voice in XR and one of the top women covering augmented reality, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence –– combining futurism with creative technology and strategic implementation. Catherine is SVP Growth at Media.Monks, where she advises leading global brands on how to enter the Metaverse; a new era of brand virtualization with innovative ideas and cutting edge technology, from enterprise to entertainment. Catherine decodes technology and interactive experiences to help companies become more resilient, efficient, and productive. With a career spanning nearly 20 years in global financial services leading institutional sales for private and equity tech investments, Catherine enables teams to better communicate, collaborate and create with tech –– no matter where they are. Catherine D. Henry is a Black female tech geek & AfroFuturist who holds an MBA, MA in economics, and speaks five languages. She did post-graduate work in immersive media & VR Film making at NY Film Academy (2016).

items.title: Shreya Bansal
items.content:
A creative enthusiast, inquisitive, fuelled by unwavering enthusiasm, I desire to build enriching & interactive experiences. My hobby of learning and exploring newer formats of experience led me to become an XR Experience Designer and finish my 2 year masters degree in Immersive Media Design.

I believe, \"The mind, once stretched by a new idea, never returns to its original dimensions.” ― Ralph Waldo Emerson

items.title: Alan Smithson – MetaVRse Engine
items.content: MetaVRse is a code-optional platform that makes it easy to create & share interactive 3D experiences instantly on the web.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den.  I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: Designing Accessible Interactions for the Immersive Web
John Akers
items.content: John Akers is the Director of Research and Education at the University of Washington Reality Lab where he manages the XR-related undergraduate research program and educational initiatives. He received bachelor\'s and master\'s degrees in Computer Science and Informatics from the University of Washington, where he researched approaches for accessible input devices for XR applications in the Taskar Center for Accessible Technology. He is also a member of the XR Access Initiative and a participant of prior W3C workshops on inclusive design for immersive web standards.

items.title: Matt Cool
items.content: Matt is a web developer interested in 3d design, Blender and creating a more open web where we can contribute to more accessible experiences and solutions.

items.title: Designing for multiple input types across devices
items.content: Now that we’ve reinvented the menu, let’s talk about managing the user’s journey from legacy keyboard and mouse input, to touch screens to controllers, hand tracking, gaze pointers, rings and gesture recognition for a wholistic look at next-gen user interfaces.

items.title: Alina Kadlubsky
items.content: Alina is an Art Director Design Researcher, WebXR Developer; Director of Communications of the Open AR Cloud Association and Managing Director of Open AR Cloud Europe gUG as well as Lead Strategist of the Cyber XR Coalition. With a passion for immersive Tech, Spatial Computing, Spatial Web and creating a human centered future of Computing.

items.title: Michael Posso
items.content: A JavaScript full-stack developer with over 10 years of expertise in creating enterprise on-line experiences. My methodology of development is based on writing maintainable code with a DevOps first mindset. My formal art & design training taught me to carefully consider my audience and create designs and applications that bring value to the user. In addition to web development, the advent of virtual reality has opened new frontiers in the areas of coding and user interfaces for immersive applications. Moreover, as an avid learner, I have taught workshops and courses in person and on-line at colleges and universities.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO/CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Yinch Yeap
items.content:
Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre.  His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks.  Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

items.title: Everything will be Gamified
items.content: Interactivity is the key to unlocking Spatial Memory, and Immersive Websites transition us from passive consumption to active participation. Through doing we become experienced, increasing retention. This is why we call them experiences.

items.title: Dominique Wu
items.content: Dominique Wu is a senior UX/UI Designer, AR/VR Designer, and Art Director specializing in the entertainment and tech industries. She has designed and developed strategies to help businesses scale sustainably and maximize growth for more than 10 years.

items.title: James Ashley
items.content:
James is currently CTO at LABLIGHTAR. 

He co-authored the popular LinkedIn Learning video course HoloLens App Development. He also wrote the technical book Beginning Kinect Programming with the Microsoft Kinect SDK. 

In a previous life, he pursued a PhD in Philosophy at Emory University, with a focus on theories of consciousness and phenomenology.

items.title: Jeremie Lasnier
items.content:
After completing his Master\'s degree in Media Design at HEAD in Geneva and being a researcher in Interaction Design at ENSAD in Paris; Jérémie Lasnier co-founded LiveLike to build immersive sports streaming experiences in VR, mobile, and web, endorsed both by the NFL and TechCrunch. As Chief Creative Officer, He pushed the boundaries of innovation by overseeing all aspects of the design from implementing interfaces, 3D environments to mixed reality augmentations. He worked with major TV channels such as Fox Sports, France TV, and SKY to broadcast the biggest events of the world like the World Cup, the Superbowl, and the final of the Champion\'s League.
Jérémie won multiple international awards such as a Samsung Design Award, VR Award, and a Gold Award at the Oculus Mobile VR Jam. He also joined the prestigious 30 under 30 Forbes List class of 2017.
In 2020, LiveLike\'s VR product got acquired by Cosm, a global company focused on design, technology, and innovation to deliver the best immersive experiences to partners around the world. Jérémie joined the leadership team as VP, Immersive Design.

items.title: Bryan Mehr
items.content: Started in Business in the Print Industry and always had an interest in different tech to compliment the print work we did. Got in to Augmented reality many years back now, which led me to learn how to actually develop it. I\'ve since worked as a developer and in several other capacities in the industry and am excited by the endless opportunities to be creative.

items.title: Art and Educational Space
items.content: This session introduces the on-going VR Art and Design coursework of Dr. Steve Guynup. It is a live VR demo with a VR audience, broadcast from Dr. Guynup's FrameVR class space. Teaching methods, creative use of space, and leveraging of virtual art and virtual poetry as inspiration for educational projects are explored. Participants will learn to look at their own works through a lens of virtual art and discover new options for crafting engaging educational outcomes.

items.title: Steve Guynup
items.content: Dr. Guynup is an award winning VR artist, author, and teacher. As an artist, his exploration of storytelling / shape changing avatars and use of poetry to unpack the design language of VR in the 1990's continues to resonate today. As a professional, he built multi-million dollar training software for for CSX Rail, Weyehauser, UPS, and more. For the past decade he's taught online, in-world, multi-user, classes on VR art and design. Dr. Guynup currently teaches at Southern New Hampshire University and is developing VR classes there.

items.title: Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg
items.content: Space Popular is directed by Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg, both alumni of the Architectural Association in London (2011). They founded the practice in Bangkok (2013) and have been based in London since 2016. Space Popular creates spaces, objects, and events in both physical and virtual space, concentrating on how the two realms can blend together. The studio has completed buildings, exhibitions, public artworks, furniture collections, and interiors across Asia and Europe, as well as virtual architecture for the immersive internet. Clients, collaborators, and commissioners include national institutions such as MAXXI - National Museum of 21st Century Art, Rome, Italy; The Swedish Centre for Architecture and Design –ArkDes, Stockholm, Sweden; Royal Institute of British Architects, London, UK; National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Seoul, South Korea; as well as independent galleries such as MAGAZIN, Vienna, Austria; and Sto Werkstatt, London, UK. Lesmes and Hellberg both have extensive academic experience having taught architectural design studio since 2011, first at INDA, Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok, since 2016 at the Architectural Association in London, and since 2020 at Daniels, Faculty of Architecture, University of Toronto. Their current MArch design and research studio at Daniels investigates visions for civic architecture in the immersive internet.

items.title: Lighting and Textures
items.content: The secret to compelling and beautiful experiences is in applying properties to objects that reflect color and provide detail, while being mindful of processing overhead. Here we reveal the tricks that pros use to produce highly performant wow factor.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Dr. Keith Chan received his Ph.D. in anthropology at the University of Missouri. He currently lives in San Diego, where he teaches biological anthropology in community colleges. Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

items.title: Zachary Capalbo
items.content: Zach Capalbo (he/him) has been dabbling with WebXR for a few years in the form of his experimental VR art creation app VARTISTE and related hobby projects.

items.title: Kitae Kim
items.content: Kitae Kim is a Co-Founder of NYC creative studio, Third Axis, building XR content and technology. Originally trained in architecture, Kitae Kim had spent his time prior to Third Axis designing large-scale interactive art installations for acclaimed media artist, Rafael Lozano-Hemmer, using 3D tools like; Rhino, Grasshopper, Blender, Touchdesigner, Houdini and Unreal Engine. He is now applying that 3D, parametric and real-time design knowledge to WebXR through Third Axis.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Conversation with Robin Hunicke and Doug North Cook
Kent Bye
items.content: Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR. He\'s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Robin Hunicke
items.content: Robin Hunicke is the CEO and co-founder of Funomena, an experimental game company working in AR, VR and traditional console & PC gaming. Focused on pushing the boundaries of gameplay and connection through new platforms, Robin is most well known for her work on Journey, The Sims, Luna and Wattam. She is also a full professor of Game Design at UC Santa Cruz, in the department of Performance, Play and Design.

items.title: Doug North Cook
items.content: Doug North Cook is an artist, professor, and researcher focused on immersive technology, interaction design, and the application of architectural theory to digital environments. He founded the Immersive Media programs at Chatham University, and runs the Immersive Design & Game Design Residencies at Fallingwater. Doug is currently working on multiple new projects including museum installations, game projects, and scientific research.

items.title: Caitlin Krause
items.content: Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide. Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

items.title: Polygons are the New “Expensive” – Optimizing for Scalability
items.content: Realism comes at a cost measured in framerates. Striking the balance between quality and performance while creating content-rich compelling experiences with that people want to enjoy and share with others is key.

items.title: Austin Caine
items.content: Austin Caine, a.k.a Cause, is a professional world designer specializing in building bespoke 3D event spaces for social VR platforms. He is a prominent builder in AltspaceVR having created some of the more popular entertainment spaces (such as The Flying Saucer and The Worm Hole) and has helped to spark innovation in many other creators. He is also an admin and consultant for the yearly BRCvr virtual \"Burning Man\" event held in Altspace, and has worked with many people to help bring their creative ideas to fruition. These days he and his partner Christi work closely together on many VR and XR projects to deliver clients a higher level of atmospheric quality while maintaining optimal download speeds and visual framerates.

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

items.title: Will Cherry
items.content: WILL CHERRY is a director, designer, and technologist specializing in the combination of hemorrhaging-edge technology with story-driven interaction design. His career creating 360 and realtime VR/AR experiences for companies like Samsung, AT&T, Apple, and more stem from a love of human-centered immersive design principles. A Swiss-army-knife of a person, his technical skillset spans AAA game and film production disciplines to drive creative solutions for any medium. His unending passion: using technology to both create art and improve the human condition through experience - be it digital, physical, or the juxtaposition of the two.

items.title: Immersive Video – Volumetric,  360°, and Parallax
items.content: Not all 3D Formats are created equal, and each have their own technical benefits and limitations. It is essential to understand the value of each and to choose which media type best serves the experience you are designing for.

items.title: Christina Heller
items.content: Christina is the CEO of Metastage. Since its founding in 2018, Metastage has completed over 150 productions with major brands and award winning projects, including two Emmy nominations. Metastage is the first North American partner for the Microsoft Mixed Reality Capture technology. Prior to leading Metastage, Christina was the CEO of VR Playhouse, an immersive content company with immersive projects featured at SXSW, Sundance, and Festival de Cannes. She is a recipient of the Advanced Imaging Society\'s Distinguished Leadership in Technology Award and was named in the Huffington Post as one of 5 women changing the virtual reality scene. Her writing and research on volumetric video has been published in the textbook, Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (2019), and What is Augmented Reality? Everything You Wanted to Know Featuring Exclusive Interviews with Leaders of the AR Industry (2019).

items.title: Hugh Hou
items.content:
Hugh Hou is a Co-Founder and Creative Director for CreatorUp, a digital media education company and production studio. He heads up immersive media content creation and has produced VR content for numerous companies and organizations such as Samsung, the Special Olympics, Google, Oculus, MasterCard, Twitter, TikTok, RedBull Music, LACOSTE, Huawei, and the Los Angeles Police Department.
He also directs and produces Mixed Reality music videos. He worked with musical artists such as I Prevail, Joyner Lucas, Kristina Sky, Roger Shah, Cypress Hill, and SHAED.
When not producing original VR videos & films, Hugh dedicates his time to sharing his vast expertise in immersive technologies and VR filmmaking on the CreatorUp YouTube channel. He truly believes that by sharing freely with the world through YouTube, mentoring and consulting, more creators will join the immersive media family.
Hugh’s goal is to help the VR industry thrive and to improve the quality of VR filmmaking.

items.title: Shawn Frayne
items.content:
Inspired by movies in the 80’s and 90’s, Shawn has been reaching towards the dream of the hologram for over 20 years. Shawn got his start with a classic laser interference pattern holographic studio he built in high school, followed by training in advanced holographic film techniques at MIT. He has been awarded dozens of patents around the world, the Popular Mechanics Breakthrough Award, and noted as one of the ‘20 Best Brains Under 40’ by Discover Magazine.

Shawn works between Brooklyn and Hong Kong where he serves as co-founder and CEO of Looking Glass Factory.

items.title: Designing for the Bigger Picture
items.content: From 2D to 3D to Immersive across all display types.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, one of the world’s leading virtual , augmented and mixed reality (XR) consulting & product development companies. Changing the way we teach using the MetaVRse game engine introducing 3D learning & spatial design without code.

items.title: Ayşegül Yönet
items.content: Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.

items.title: Michael DiBenigno
items.content:
Story without data is an antidote, data without a story lacks empathy, but a data story can spark a movement. Michael is a data storyteller with a 100k following on TikTok as @the.data.guy

He is also a co-founder of Flow Immersive which is a data storytelling platform for authoring and presenting data stories.

Prior to Flow, Michael was a manager in the Strategy practice at Deloitte Consulting.

items.title: Ricardo Cabello – Mr. Doob
items.content:
Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

items.title: WebXR Unity Exporter
items.content:
Current state of WebXR in Unity

A showcase of experiences.

  • - What is currently possible/supported.
  • - What is planned next.
  • - Good use cases for the current state of the extension

items.title: Oren De-Panther Weizman
items.content:
Oren (De-Panther) Weizman, is a VR/AR developer that loves to experiment with new tech.
He is a Co-Admin at the Israeli Unity Developers group.
Co-Founder at Total-Viz, where he develops XR games.
A Software Developer at Resonai, where he is part of the team that works on Vera, an AR platform that transforms physical spaces into intelligent digital environments.
In his spare time, he works on WebXR Export, a Unity XR package that allows developers to build WebXR experiences using Unity.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Will Eastcott
items.content: Will Eastcott is the creator of PlayCanvas, the online collaborative game engine built on WebGL and WebXR. Will has been building AAA games and engines since 1997, holding senior positions at EA, Sony and Activision. He also holds an Individual Contributor membership with the Khronos Group and is extremely active in the WebGL and glTF ecosystems. He's a quintessential Englishman who loves to drink tea and complain about the weather.

items.title: Stewart Smith
items.content: I’m a lucky guy—I get paid to invent fun things. Currently, I work for Amazon as a global consultant on virtual reality and spatial computing. On the weekends I maintain Q, a browser-based quantum circuit simulation framework.

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010.  He is currently  Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: Corentin Wallez
items.content: Currently leading the WebGPU efforts on the Chromium side and chair of the WebGPU W3C group.

items.title: WebXR Hit Test in MetaVRse Engine
Walid Abdelaty
items.content:
Co-Founder & CTO of Metavrse
Former Co-Founder and CTO of Cherry3D
Life Long Developer

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010.  He is currently  Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Lisi Linares
items.content:
LISI LINARES is the founder of LNRS PR+ XR TLNT MNGMNT,  a boutique publicity and talent management agency that operates in stealth mode. All of the clients come word of mouth.

VR has been Lisi’s passion since she wrote her first VR script at NYU Film in 1994. Too early to start a career in VR, Lisi began making music. She recorded and released songs with influential label, Ze Records. Her music attracted the casting agent for SURVIVOR. She went on to appear as a castaway on season 14. Doing press junkets for CBS lead to a pointing point.  “I really got into how a story is pitched and how the narrative of a character is shaped in the media”

In 2015, Lisi co-founded a public relations agency representing primarily Crypto and Blockchain projects. After premiering the first Anime on the blockchain, Vevara in Your Dream and working with some of the bigger projects in the space such as David Chaum’s Elixxir, Path Network and NGRAVE, it was time to move on.
During the summer of 2019 Lisi saw an opportunity to pivot into VR, the great love of her life! Starting with consulting AR start-ups, she quickly became immersed in the XR community. “I feel like I had found my tribe.”

March 2021, Lisi expanded her publicity services to include managing xr talent. She is actively bridging the gap between 20th and 21st century entertainment. Consulting talent agencies on how to prepare their talent roster was the inspiration behind XR TLNT MNGMNT.
