Lisi is a proud Board Member of the Femme Futures Grant at Artizen and XR Women.

Stay tuned more to come...

items.title: Jono Brandel
items.content:
Jonathan (Jono) Brandel is an award winning graphic designer and computer programmer. He comes from mixed heritage, an American of Filipino and Polish descent. As such Jono pairs distinct subjects to frame the creative process. These combinations range from latin and emojis to lithography and pixel sorting. While pairings vary, there is an accessible tenor to the digital and physical objects he produces. This attention to detail allows people to access complex subject matters including positivism, the collision of black holes, and music composition with ease.

With a Bachelor’s in Design | Media Arts, a Minor in Latin from the University of California, Los Angeles, and a Master of Fine Arts in New Media from Paris College of Art, Jono’s work has been shown at international festivals including TED, Sundance, Tribeca Film Festival, SIGGRAPH, and the Japan Media Arts Festival. His commitment to Visual Music has sparked collaborations with musicians including applications with Lullatone, a live performance with Nosaj Thing, and interactive music videos for the likes of Matthew Dear, the Chemical Brothers, and Kimbra.
To develop his projects Jono writes custom software and actively participates in open source communities. He shares his own libraries such as the event driven two-dimensional drawing interface for the web, Two.js. This library and many others are freely available and actively maintained to help promote the creative expression of individuals worldwide.

items.title: Brendan Bradley
items.content: Brendan Andolsek Bradley is a multi-award winning actor, writer, director and producer known internationally as "America's Scrappy Storyteller" (AR Post) with 100+ IMDb credits, 50M+ views online and a leader in the virtual theater movement performing using groundbreaking XR/VR tools. Brendan established The Integrative Technology Lab at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts to foster the next generation of multi-disciplinary live storytellers and during the pandemic, he began releasing free tutorials and case-studies for adopting ubiquitous streaming tools for live performance, including a customizable virtual theater in your web browser that allows anyone in the world to get back "on" stage for free. More at brendanAbradley.com/futurestages

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content: Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production. Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, one of the world’s leading virtual , augmented and mixed reality (XR) consulting & product development companies. Changing the way we teach using the MetaVRse game engine introducing 3D learning & spatial design without code.

items.title: Blair MacIntyre
items.content: Blair MacIntyre is a Professor of Interactive Computing at Georgia Tech, where he has explored socio-technical issues surrounding AR and VR for more than 20 years. He has built authoring toolkits for media designers, deployed room-scale and handheld games and experiences, built AR-enabled web-browsers, helped lead the design of WebXR, and run online conferences using immersive social VR. His experience spans all aspects of building, deploying, and evaluating AR and VR tools, systems, and experiences. He has been doing research in augmented reality since 1991, is actively involved with numerous conferences and workshops, speaks and consults regularly, and has published over 100 academic papers in the field.

items.title: Brian Peiris
items.content: Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community. Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

items.title: Elgin-Skye McLaren
items.content: Elgin-Skye McLaren is a Senior Product Manager for Mozilla Hubs - an open source platform for creating and sharing 3D social spaces on the web. She holds an MSc in Interactive Arts and Technology from Simon Fraser University. When she isn't working on Hubs or exploring VR she enjoys roller skating and building cool stuff with code.

items.title: James Baicoianu
items.content: Exploring the possibilities of the web

items.title: Liam Broza
items.content:
Liam Broza is the creator of LifeScope.io and Laguna Labs. LifeScope is an Open Source AI assisted personal database for private real time data collection.

Laguna Labs created XREngine; an immersive social experience that is delivered through just your internet browser. Anyone can create virtual spaces and events with approachable open source tools.

items.title: Clayton Banks
items.content:
Tedx and Global speaker. Experienced Executive with strong leadership and strategic skills. Recently recognized as the 2013 "Business Person of the Year" by the Harlem Business Alliance for implementing innovative strategies for non-profit and for profit clients and exceeding objectives.

Skilled in content, technology, brand development, multimedia, online web and multiplatform production, for domestic and international operations. A track record of positive results in P&L management, multi-channel distribution, product launches, new market recognition, and growing the bottom-line while motivating an accomplished staff in a dynamic business environment.

items.title: Raanan Weber
items.content:
Back in 2014 Raanan had made his first contribution to Babylon.js - the web 3D engine. Since then he has continuously contributed to the open source framework as a community member. For the last year he has been working as a software developer @ Microsoft in the Babylon.js team. A major part of his time is invested in developing and maintaining Babylon's WebXR support. The rest of the time he is trying to configure build systems, fight React, and catch up on E-Mails.
He resides in Berlin, Germany, and enjoys playing multiplayer games with his family, making music, and practicing magic tricks that get him nowhere.

items.title: Oculus Browser and the Immersive Web
Dave Hill
items.content: Hi, I'm Dave Hill. I'm an Engineering Manager at Oculus/Facebook Reality Labs, supporting the Oculus Browser team and focusing on the web developer ecosystem as it relates to our headsets and our browser. Prior to joining Oculus, I spent time at Microsoft working on HoloLens, and on Xbox Kinect before that. Before that, I spent a bunch of years working in game development working on gameplay, graphics, and engine programming.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Dr. Keith Chan received his Ph.D. in anthropology at the University of Missouri. He currently lives in San Diego, where he teaches biological anthropology in community colleges. Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

items.title: Diego Marcos Segura
items.content: A-Frame co-creator and main maintainer. I was part of the original team at Mozilla that kickstarted the WebVR standard.

items.title: Active Theory – Secret Sky and Dreamwave
Nick Mountford
items.content: Nick provides strategic leadership to clients and the production team across Dreamwave and Active Theory projects.

items.title: WebXR Business Summit
items.content:
Thank you for participating in the WebXR Business Summit hosted by Samantha Mathews on September 14, 2021

Stay tuned for the launch of the individual videos, coming soon.

The summit featured WebXR business leaders and pioneers sharing their knowledge of and experience with immersive technologies, which are already producing ROI through work efficiencies, improved performances, and a sustainable global footprint. 

Perspectives include WebXR success stories, lessons learned, persona alignment, communication, and collaboration to ensure successful business outcomes.  

Galaxy Sponsor

We encourage you to join the community by coming to the watch parties hosted on SEVEN different platforms for this event! Thank you to all the people that helped make this possible.

items.title: WebXR Design Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Design Summit introduces applications of spatial computing to interactive storytelling and the user design experience. 


The world’s WebXR experts, 3D designers, and marketers will share design principles and best practices for immersive technologies. In order to reap the benefits of WebXR, professionals need to know how to create content for the medium, and the Design Summit will show the way. 


Spatial design is still new. Attendees at the summit will learn key tools, design considerations for 3D, and spatial thinking. Attendees will hear about WebXR success stories, common pitfalls to avoid, and design tips

items.title: Terry xR. Schussler
items.content: Terry xR. Schussler is an award-winning software designer/developer currently driving @deutschetelekom’s XR HMD initiatives as Senior Director, Spatial Computing. Terry co-produced the XRCollaboration.com website - part of his effort to inspire us to use XR technologies to improve our interactions with each other and the real world. His mission is to encourage us to move from a heads-down to a heads-up society. Terry regularly mentors innovators trying to make a difference in XR through Deutsche Telekom’s startup accelerator hub:raum and other programs.

items.title: Oren De-Panther Weizman
items.content:
Oren (De-Panther) Weizman, is a VR/AR developer that loves to experiment with new tech.
He is a Co-Admin at the Israeli Unity Developers group.
Co-Founder at Total-Viz, where he develops XR games.
A Software Developer at Resonai, where he is part of the team that works on Vera, an AR platform that transforms physical spaces into intelligent digital environments.
In his spare time, he works on WebXR Export, a Unity XR package that allows developers to build WebXR experiences using Unity.

items.title: Yinch Yeap
items.content:
Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre.  His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks.  Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

items.title: Michael DiBenigno
items.content:
Story without data is an antidote, data without a story lacks empathy, but a data story can spark a movement. Michael is a data storyteller with a 100k following on TikTok as @the.data.guy

He is also a co-founder of Flow Immersive which is a data storytelling platform for authoring and presenting data stories.

Prior to Flow, Michael was a manager in the Strategy practice at Deloitte Consulting.

items.title: Jason Marsh
items.content: Jason Marsh is the technical founder and CEO of Flow Immersive, a company focused on Data Storytelling with WebXR. Jason is obsessed with the brain science around how we can build better mental models of our data and information, understanding the limitations of slideware, and encoding better science into a product for anyone to build data presentations.

items.title: Fabien Bénétou
items.content: Fabien Bénétou is a WebXR freelance developer currently working for UNICEF and the European Parliament. Based in Brussels, Belgium, Fabien is a Mozilla AFrame contributor driven by the need to make virtual and augmented reality understandable by anybody curious enough to try. He has organized events, given talks and lead dozens of professional workshops all around the world. His focus goes beyond the technology to the positive impact it can offer through privacy conscious methods to bring VR and AR innovations to the most wide possible audience. He is convinced that XR will become useful once used and challenged by the most diverse audience.

items.content: Artur Sychov is Founder and CEO of Somnium Space. He has been navigating virtual worlds for more than two decades starting with Ultima Online in 1999, then Second Life and many more. Artur strongly believes in the ultimate future of Virtual Reality worlds with open and decentralized economy.

items.title: Chris Madsen
items.content:
Recognizing VR\'s potential to profoundly disrupt the way humans learn, play, work and share experiences. Chris shifted focus in 2013 from a 20 year career in behavioral health to focus exclusively on the reinvigorated modern consumer VR movement and global development community to better understand and prepare for the evolution of experiential communication.
 
Chris is known for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of immersive tech,  experiencing a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for leading Virtual Reality tech blog, Road to VR, co-founder of the Utah VR group, Ambassador for Edge of Discovery, Siggraph judge and ongoing speaker and consultant.

Chris worked on persistent virtual identity systems and methods while Director of VR/AR at Morph 3D/Tafi, founded Digital Realities XR consultant company and now dedicates  his time helping helping enterprise and educational institutions learn how to leverage the strengths of  collaborative VR across a variety of use cases in his business development role at Immersive VR Education, makers of the ENGAGE collaboration, training, education and events platform.

items.title: Caitlin Krause
items.content: Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide. Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

items.title: 2021 – WebXR Community Award
items.content:
The WebXR Community Award honors outstanding contributions in sharing information about WebXR.

We are honoring Trevor for his dedication to supporting the WebXR Community through the W3C Community Group, Immersive Web Weekly, as host of the WebXR Developer Summit, and via social media. Thank you Trevor. We love you.

items.content: Jacob is the Product Manager for the web platform at Oculus, leading the product development of Oculus Browser, WebXR, and Progressive Web Apps for all of Oculus's VR devices. Jacob has helping develop browsers, web standards, and developer tools at Microsoft, the W3C, and Oculus for over 12 years.

He is now applying that 3D, parametric and real-time design knowledge to WebXR through Third Axis.

items.title: 2021 – Ombudsperson Award
items.content:
The Ombudsperson Award honors achievement in promoting public awareness of philosophical, ethical and human rights issue in XR.

As a veteran engineer and pioneer in XR, Avi Bar-Zeev has consistently presented thoughtful reflections on the impact of advanced technologies. Thank you Avi for expanding our perspective to keep these tools in service of humanity, without becoming a cookbook.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content: Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR. He\'s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Gabe Baker
items.content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den.  I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

items.title: Artsy Marie
items.content:
I’m a multidisciplinary POC artist from Kentucky. I’m a VR enthusiast and a life long creative. When I was a kid I used to make houses out of paper, when I was a teen I played a copious amount of The Sims, when I went to college I started my art business doing professional photography, graphic design, web design, painting and illustration.

It wasn’t until 2020 that I discovered a love for digital 3D modeling. Exploring social apps on the Oculus Quest during the pandemic, I was immediately drawn to building worlds for people to socialize in.
In the past 12 months I have created and shared over 150 originally crafted VR templates and there are over 2,100 worlds that have my signature on them.

I design all of my environments, structures and furnishings from scratch, having no previous experience in 3D or VR before the joining Altspace. I am the first world builder to successfully monetize templates via Patreon memberships, with over 200 Patrons since November of 2020. I’ve paved the way for other artists in the space to get paid and I teach dozens of aspiring world builders daily and free of charge. Having hosted over 50 events in Altspace, I’ve also introduced countless users to the platform.

I have worked with several notable organizations within VR, such as Naughty by Nature, Public Enemy, The Harlem Film House, BRCvr, DreamlandXR and NFT Oasis and many of my colleagues have as well.

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content: Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps. She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.title: Caitlin Krause
items.content: Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide. Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

items.title: John Collins
items.content: "the Paper Airplane Guy"

items.title: 2021 – Lifetime Achievement Award
items.content:
The Poly for Lifetime Achivement honors individuals who have made invaluable contributions to the WebXR Stack.

We are honoring Brandon Jones for his work in bringing excellence in 3D Graphics to the Web through WebVR, WebXR and WebGPU. Thank you Brandon for everything you have done to help accelerate this medium for web developers to deliver immersive experiences through browsers.

items.title: Jacquelyn Morie
items.content:
Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Dr. Keith Chan received his Ph.D. in anthropology at the University of Missouri. He currently lives in San Diego, where he teaches biological anthropology in community colleges. Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

items.title: John Collins
items.content: "the Paper Airplane Guy"

items.title: Yinch Yeap
items.content:
Yinch is a software engineer who works in the games and real time graphics space. His recent projects have included a VR ski fitness game, a jetliner cockpit procedural trainer and MRI machine simulator. He believes that technology should help solve real world problems and make life better.

He works closely with local schools to give access to immersive, interactive and inspiring VR learning experiences, ranging from an ISS jetpack adventure to Shakespeare\'s Globe Theatre.  His company also runs programmes that encourage pupils to learn coding skills.

Before VR, his company has worked on video installations, healthcare mobile apps, treadmill fitness software and interactive 3D kiosks.  Clients including Bank of America, Ford Motor Company and Samsung USA.

Yinch founded playko after working as lead developer on console games and multimedia titles. He graduated with a Masters in Engineering from Imperial College, London.

items.title: Neil Trevett
items.content: Neil works at NVIDIA to help developers use GPUs and is involved with open standards to help the industry move forward so we can all see what comes next sooner. The metaverse has been a long-term inspiration, even if he didn’t realize it at the time. He has helped OpenGL onto PCs, served as President of the Web3D Consortium, and as Khronos President has been involved in the creation of multiple widely adopted standards for 3D and XR including OpenGL ES, WebGL, Vulkan, SPIR-V, glTF and OpenXR.

items.title: John Collins
items.content: "the Paper Airplane Guy"

items.title: Nick Mountford
items.content: Nick provides strategic leadership to clients and the production team across Dreamwave and Active Theory projects.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, one of the world’s leading virtual , augmented and mixed reality (XR) consulting & product development companies. Changing the way we teach using the MetaVRse game engine introducing 3D learning & spatial design without code.

items.title: June Wang
items.content: Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies.  She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem. She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless.   In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device.  In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line.  In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS).  In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.

items.title: Daniel Ljunggren
items.content: Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

items.title: FIVARS
items.content: Festival of International Virtual and Augmented Reality Storytelling

items.title: James Baicoianu
items.content: Exploring the possibilities of the web

items.title: Christi Fenison
items.content:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.
By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.
Christi received her Master\'s degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

items.title: Austin Caine
items.content: Austin Caine, a.k.a Cause, is a professional world designer specializing in building bespoke 3D event spaces for social VR platforms. He is a prominent builder in AltspaceVR having created some of the more popular entertainment spaces (such as The Flying Saucer and The Worm Hole) and has helped to spark innovation in many other creators. He is also an admin and consultant for the yearly BRCvr virtual \"Burning Man\" event held in Altspace, and has worked with many people to help bring their creative ideas to fruition. These days he and his partner Christi work closely together on many VR and XR projects to deliver clients a higher level of atmospheric quality while maintaining optimal download speeds and visual framerates.

items.title: Elgin-Skye McLaren
items.content: Elgin-Skye McLaren is a Senior Product Manager for Mozilla Hubs - an open source platform for creating and sharing 3D social spaces on the web. She holds an MSc in Interactive Arts and Technology from Simon Fraser University. When she isn't working on Hubs or exploring VR she enjoys roller skating and building cool stuff with code.

items.title: Brian Peiris
items.content: Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community. Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

items.title: Ada Rose Cannon
items.content: Ada is a developer advocate for the Android web browser Samsung Internet. She also co-chairs the W3C Immersive Web groups which are developing the WebXR APIs.

items.title: Chris Wilson
items.content: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010.  He is currently  Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

items.title: Ayşegül Yönet
items.content: Ayşegül Yönet is a Senior Azure Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft and focusing on Cognitive Services, Spatial Computing and WebXR. She is a co-chair of W3C Immersive Web Working Group and Community Group working on WebXR Device APIs.
